column1:
RE: Curious Student^Hello Darren:

 

We currently have only had two classes come through our program
column2:
we are a relatively new Masters Program here at NU. Our first cohort had 32 students accepted but only 30 students enrolled. Our second cohort was the full 32 students. We will only accept 32 this year as well. In terms of project work and in keeping with our goal to provide a cohort system we are unlikely to be expanding the numbers much in the future. 

 

I hope this answers your question
column3:
please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: question about application^Hello Stephanie:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question when we are evaluating a transcript we look for candidates to have a background in statistics. It is beneficial to have both calculus and linear algebra on the transcript as well
column2: but not necessarily required. Our current student profile has the majority of accepted students coming from an Engineering background (38%)
column3:
so I would agree that the engineering background is well suited for this program. 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column5: Gender mix: Male 69%
column6: Female 31%
column7: Nationality: US 62.5%
column8:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column9: 28% Economics and Social Sciences
column12:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column17:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column19: and the deadline will be in February 15
column20:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the  <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html> registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1:
RE: Admission Questions^Dear Fan: 

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.


To answer your questions:

1.       We do not have any strict prerequisite courses
column2: but we look for you to have taken calculus and statistics courses. We are more focused on the quantitative background when we are evaluating transcripts. In terms of computer science backgrounds
column3: we provide a 2 week boot camp training session before our academic calendar begins. This boot camp brings in industry trainers from SQL
column5: SPSS
column6: SAS
column7: and Tableau to train our students. Some accepted students will enter the program with a background in Java and Python but it is not a requirement for applying. \r\n\r\n2.       I encourage you to supply your UNM transcript. You can list it as a separate education experience in the online application. When you do so
column8: it will allow me to upload your transcript under the correct heading
column9:
as opposed to uploading it as other

3.       Your decision to take online courses in Coursera should be included in your resume or CV. Many accepted students went that route to strengthen their application. Any certification of your knowledge will help make you stand out against other applicants.

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column10: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column14: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column15:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column20:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column24:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column25: 28% Consulting and Professional Services
column26: 22% Information Technology
column27: 6% Academia
column28: 6% Finance
column29:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column30: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column31: and the deadline will be in February 15
column32:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the  <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html> registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

column1:
RE: Prospective Applicant^Hello Bella:

 

We accept 32 students a year. While this will undoubtedly mean that admission will be highly selective
column2:
it will also mean we can give appropriate attention to those who are admitted. We are aiming to foster a collaborative atmosphere within the program and believe that a small cohort of exceptionally talented and strongly motivated students will best enable us to achieve this. 

 

While we have many students enrolled in our program form CS and EE backgrounds we do not limit our admissions process to those academic majors. We look to build a collaborative cohort each year with a variety of backgrounds and interests. We have not had students in our program with a similar background to yours and I would be sure to mention that in your personal statement. As an academic institution we are very interested in applying analytics in a wide variety of fields of interest. I would not look at your background as weaker or negative
column3:
but unique. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column5: Gender mix: Male 69%
column6: Female 31%
column7: Nationality: US 62.5%
column8:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column9: 28% Economics and Social Sciences
column12:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column17:
4% Engineering

 

Please let me know what other questions and concerns you have about applying to our program.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market.

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question regarding financial support
column2: we do not provide teaching or research assistant positions in our program. The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column3: no additional applications will need to be submitted for consideration. For more information in regards to financial aid and funding
column4: I encourage you to explore those possibilities on our website

linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> .

column2: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction
column3: so
column4: you would not be required to submit scores. We accept scanned transcripts for the application process
column5: and should you be accepted
column6:
it would be an acceptance contingent on receiving original transcripts from each of your degree-granting institutions. 

 

To answer your questions
column7: the MSiA program is full-time for 15 months (including a required summer industry-focused internship). There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column9:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/ <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/> 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column10: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column14: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column15:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column20:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column24:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column25: 28% Consulting and Professional Services
column26: 22% Information Technology
column27: 6% Academia
column28: 6% Finance
column29:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 2014. I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column30:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2015!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1: RE: Need Information MS Program^Dear Dillip
column2:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market.

 

Currently
column3: we are unable to accept students into a spring quarter. We only accept students in the fall
column4:
due to the amount of group work and our 9month industry practicum project (which starts in the fall). We will open applications in Sept 2014. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column5: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience
column7: strong test scores
column9: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column10:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column15:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column19:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September.  I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

I apologize for the delay in my response time. Things in our office have been especially busy with applications. I would like to reassure you that we have received your letters of recommendation (you have sent a separate email inquiring about this) and we had received your payment on time. We use a third party to collect  all of our application payments at the University and we receive weekly reports with the payments. Unfortunately
column2:
our application managing system was a little overextended and was not updating with our changes. I did note now that your page does reflect receipt of the payment. 

 

We have made your application packet and it is being reviewed. Please let me know if you have any additional questions.

column1:
RE: Admission Enquiry for Masters of Science in Analytics^Dear Aditi:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question we primarily will evaluate candidates based on their quantitative background. I see you have Statistics and Calculus on your transcripts. Those are some of the key classes we look at to evaluate our applicants with. We do not expect you to have experience in programing. We provide a two-week boot camp where we have industry partners from SAS
column2: SQL
column3: tableau
column4:
etc. come to campus for full-day instruction and informational sessions. You are not required to have a mastery of these programs prior to entering the MSiA program. We also include classes such as java as a foundation course in the first quarter. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column5: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience
column7: strong test scores
column9: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column10:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column15:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column19:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column25: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column26: and the deadline will be in February 15
column27:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column28:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: aditi viswanath xxx@xxx.xxx 

Thanking You

Aditi Viswanath

RE: career questions about MSiA^Dear Tien:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics program began with the 2012-2013 academic year; our first cohort is currently in their final stages and has not yet graduated. We are unable to provide the specific information you have requested. We will be looking to update the website with our students job placement information shortly. This field is expanding exponentially and there are fantastic job opportunities available to graduates of the Master of Science in Analytics program. Future job opportunities include: Lead analyst for a Fortune 500 firm
column2: Statistical Modeling Analysts
column3: Digital Strategy Analysts
column5: Systems Engineers
column6: Consultants
column7:
or Entrepreneur.

 

Please check our website in the upcoming month after graduation for our statistics on job placements and companies our students received offers from.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2:
we accept scanned copies of your transcript. You do not need to send us an official transcript from your University. You can send us the PDF to this email address. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants

column2: GMAT
column3: TOEFL) - Nitika Lal^Dear Nitika;\r\n\r\nThank you for submitting your transcripts and additional materials to the Master of Science in Analytics at Northwestern University. We have uploaded them into our MAP system and it should be reflected in your account within 24 hours. The scanned version of your transcript is the only requirement for your application
column4:
we will ask for an official transcript if you are accepted into the program. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions regarding the MS in Analytics program. We will announce our admission decisions on March 18th. 

 

I apologize for not responding to your inquiry earlier. We have had a high volume of emails due to the upcoming deadline for applications and have been slow to respond to student inquiry. You will not need to send an official transcript until you have been accepted into the program. In regards to your TOEFL and GMAT scan; we have not yet received your scores but will include them in your application when they arrive. Please note that we have marked your additional materials as received in your Student Checklist.

 

We look forward to reviewing your application. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: prospective student^Dear Ricky:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2: we would be happy to accommodate a 15min phone call. To address one of your comments
column3:
we are not currently accepting applicants outside of a Fall start date. The next available admit would be Fall 2015. I hope this will not discourage you from your interest in our program. Due to industry related projects and the structure of our program we admit students in a cohort for 15month cycles.

 

Either the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission. Admissions for this program is very competitive
column4: we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year.

 

For more information regarding our specific application requirements I encourage you to explore our program website at http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/ and keep in touch on twitter xxx@xxx.xxx 

 

Follow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxx 

 

 

 

 

From: Ricky Salgado xxx@xxx.xxx 
Sent: Saturday
column11:
2014 10:51 AM
To: Master of Science in Analytics
Subject: prospective student

 

Hello
column12: \r\n\r\n     I am a very interested student that will be applying for winter quarter
column13: before I do I wanted to know if it will be okay if I can come in and talk to someone
column14:
ask a couple of questions regarding the department and basically see what I can mention in my essay for the department? 

thank you!

^Master of Science in Analytics^/o=nuexch/ou=Exchange Administrative Group (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/cn=Recipients/cn=vlr2122d7^EX^'Ricky xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: a question on online course certificate^Dear Jacob

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

To address your specific question
column2: I would encourage you to obtain certificates and diversify your education by including courses as you suggested via coursera.  We see many applications come through our office and we will take into consideration any additional language skills you have (Java
column4: Ruby etc) which will make you the best candidate to go through our course. Even if you find a couple of these specific areas redundant in our course structure
column5: they will help you succeed with our industry based projects and advanced curriculum. \r\n\r\nEither the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission. Admissions for this program is very competitive
column6: we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column7: so industry experience
column9: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column10: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column11:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year.

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2014 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column16: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Finance
column25: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 1 and our application process is not rolling. I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2017!

Victoria L. Richmond
Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: Enquiry - Master of Science in Analytics^Dear Sridevi:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Either the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission. Admissions for this program is very competitive
column2: we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. You have until January 15th to complete your testing. With this time frame we will require you to complete one of the aforementioned test options.

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2014 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:

column1:
RE: Request information - Masters in analysis^Dear Shikhar:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

You have asked a great deal of very informative questions. 

 

With regards to the technical nature of our program
column2: I would encourage you to evaluate our courses and skills on our curriculum page. Each student will leave the program with a highly increased technical skill (ie Java
column5:
Ruby etc). Please look at our curriculum page <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/curriculum/index.html>  for specifics. 

 

Either the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission. Admissions for this program is very competitive
column6: we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column7: so industry experience
column9: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column10: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column11:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year.

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2014 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column16:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Finance
column25:
4% Engineering

 

We are proud to announce that out of the 29 graduates seeking jobs after graduating from our program we placed 97% within one month of graduation. For more details regarding our Internship and Career placement please look on our Career page <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/career%20placement.html>  on our website. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 1

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2: we will support our students in any direction they look to go with analytics. We have had students intern and continue to work in startups
column3: for more information on internship and career placement please look at our website <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/career%20placement.html> . We offer a couple classes which are focused on the entrepreneurial side of business
column5:
you can find out more information in the Northwestern course catalogue. We have seen an increase in the number of applications we receive each year. We accept 32 students at a little under a 10% acceptance rate. 

 

Either the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission. Admissions for this program is very competitive

column1:
RE: Prospective Applicant^Hello Bella:

 

We accept 32 students a year. While this will undoubtedly mean that admission will be highly selective
column2:
it will also mean we can give appropriate attention to those who are admitted. We are aiming to foster a collaborative atmosphere within the program and believe that a small cohort of exceptionally talented and strongly motivated students will best enable us to achieve this. 

 

While we have many students enrolled in our program form CS and EE backgrounds we do not limit our admissions process to those academic majors. We look to build a collaborative cohort each year with a variety of backgrounds and interests. We have not had students in our program with a similar background to yours and I would be sure to mention that in your personal statement. As an academic institution we are very interested in applying analytics in a wide variety of fields of interest. I would not look at your background as weaker or negative
column3:
but unique. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column5: Gender mix: Male 69%
column6: Female 31%
column7: Nationality: US 62.5%
column8:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column9: 28% Economics and Social Sciences
column12:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column17:
4% Engineering

 

Please let me know what other questions and concerns you have about applying to our program.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: Regarding Admission in M.S(Analytics)^Dear Prakhar:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question about our scholarship options; we offer a limited number of fellowships to applicants. These fellowships will pay for fifty percent (50%) of tuition costs for the 4 quarters you are taking classes on campus. We determine who receives those fellowships solely on merit. Your application to our program is the means that we evaluate candidates for fellowships. There are additional funding opportunities at Northwestern University
column2: but we do not have any input or control over those scholarships. I have linked our page on Tuition and Fees <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html>  from our website
column3:
which provides more contacts for tuition funding here at Northwestern.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). Many applicants will provide their GRE scores as proof of their quantitative background
column5: I would recommend you submit your scores if you believe it will strengthen your application. The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience
column7: strong test scores
column9: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column10:

column1:
RE: International application^Dear Jing.

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. [INSERT SPECIFIC QUESTION ANSWERS HERE] The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

To answer your question
column2: we do not have a separate deadline for international students. Please make sure all of your application materials are in by February 15th. \r\n\r\nBoth GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15
column25: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

We are so excited by your enthusiasm for data analytics and our program. Unfortunately
column2: we are currently in the process of moving into an exciting new space to accommodate our expanding program. Due to the upcoming move we will not be able to accommodate on campus visits before the start of the new year. I apologize for the inconvenience

column1:
RE: 2015-2016 Inquiry - MSiA^Dear Katayani:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Please see below for answers to your specific questions:

1.       We are housed within the McCormick Technological Institute
column2: and our home department is within Industrial Engineering and Management Studies. Therefore
column3: we are an accredited STEM program
column4: and we do provide OPT to international students who qualify. \r\n\r\n2.       We look for candidates with a strong quantitative background and experience with computer languages. We do not specify which languages
column5: but your IT background is taken into consideration when we are determining candidacy.\r\n\r\n3.       With regards to your LOR
column6: our list of preferred letters of recommendation are only a guideline. You decide who will best speak to your capabilities as a candidate. Since we are a strong academic program
column7: having someone who can speak to your skills in a classroom environment is beneficial while we are evaluating your application. If however
column8:
you prefer to have workplace letters of recommendation we will still read through your application unbiased.

 

For more information regarding our specific application requirements I encourage you to explore our program website at http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/ and keep in touch on twitter xxx@xxx.xxx 

Follow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: MSiA Program^Dear Matthew:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.  The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Please refer to below for answers to your questions:

 

1.       Typically we do not release this information about our students. We require a minimum GPA of 3.0. Since we do not require a GRE we do not provide average scores
column2: and we require a minimum of 85 in our TOEFL scores
column3: to gauge the caliber of students admitted into our program I encourage you to look at our Current students page which provides an effective class profile.\r\n\r\n2.       Due to the project based nature of our program we require our students to graduate within the 15months they are enrolled in our program. We are a cohort based system. You will be a part of a 9month industry practicum project
column4: which solves real world issues with business. Then you enter a required 10 week internship
column5:
where you will apply your knowledge of analytics in an internship setting. Your final project is a capstone project which is a 3month industry supplied project where you demonstrate what you have learnt at Northwestern University. Each of these projects are team based and are required to be completed by deadline. 

3.       Each year we aim to enroll 32 students to our cohort. 

4.       I encourage you to provide recommendations from whomever gives us the best sense of your analytics background. The guidelines on the website are a suggestion
column6:
but we would like to have a rounded understanding of what your analytics background is and what exposure/experience you have had in analytics.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column7: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: strong test scores
column11: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column12:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

column21:

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None

column25: 6% Finance

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

RE: Application Deadline^Dear Rohan;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question; we do not accept students on a rolling admissions. We will not begin reviewing applications until after February 15th. No matter when you submit your application (as long as all of your materials arrive before the deadline) you will be given an equal advantage of all our applicants. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program

We currently have only had two classes come through our program

column1:
RE: career questions about MSiA^Dear Tien:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics program began with the 2012-2013 academic year; our first cohort is currently in their final stages and has not yet graduated. We are unable to provide the specific information you have requested. We will be looking to update the website with our students job placement information shortly. This field is expanding exponentially and there are fantastic job opportunities available to graduates of the Master of Science in Analytics program. Future job opportunities include: Lead analyst for a Fortune 500 firm
column2: Statistical Modeling Analysts
column3: Digital Strategy Analysts
column5: Systems Engineers
column6: Consultants
column7:
or Entrepreneur.

 

Please check our website in the upcoming month after graduation for our statistics on job placements and companies our students received offers from.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column8: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: so industry experience
column12: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score

column2: you will not need to submit a TOEFL score as long as the degree granting institution (Univ. of Michigan) is an English speaking institution. \r\n2. Unfortunately
column3: we currently do not offer a PhD in Analytics. We only provide the MS degree. If you are looking to go into academia with analytics
column4: the IEMS department here at Northwestern offers an Analytics focus. That may be a better fit for you if you are looking to get a PhD. Currently
column5:
I do not know of any institutions which offers Analytics as a field for PhD's. 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market.

column1:
RE: MS in Business Analytics : Fall 2014^Dear S Nayak:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

 

Please see below for answers to your questions:

1.       We are a masters program housed under the Industrial Engineering and Management Studies department. Because we are we do qualify as a STEM program. 

2.       Tuition Fees <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> : For the 2013-2014 it will be $15
column2: 038/qtr. Your tuition will be due for the fall
column3: winter
column4: and spring quarters but not in the summer. \r\n\r\n3.       We offer a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column5: no additional application will need to be submitted for consideration. Please visit the Tuition and Fees page on our website for more opportunities of financial support within the Northwestern School system. We only control the Fellowships offered by our program. \r\n\r\n4.       We encourage you to submit a GRE score if you believe it will help prove your quantitative knowledge to our admissions committee. If you feel your academic transcript does not show your quantitative background then I would suggest submitting the GRE. 75% of our accepted students had submitted their scores. This is not a requirement for consideration for our program
column6: nor for our Fellowship.\r\n\r\n5.       Estimated Cost of Living: We tell students to budget around $22
column7: 000 for living expenses. There is a full breakdown of our costs on the Tuition page of our website. \r\n\r\n6.       In terms of Financial documents
column8: we do not require those. That is outside of our office
column9:
if you have questions I would suggest reaching out to the International Office to discuss obtaining an I20

7.       Currently we are graduating our inaugural cohort. We do not yet have any job placement statistics to provide. Once our students have graduated we will be updating our website with that information. Please check back with us at the end of December. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

column1:
RE: Questions for applying master in analytics program^Dear Wangyang:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

1.  To answer your question
column2: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction
column3: so
column4: you would not be required to submit scores. We accept scanned transcripts for the application process
column5: and should you be accepted
column6: it would be an acceptance contingent on receiving original transcripts from each of your degree-granting institutions.\r\n2.  Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column7: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. We do not have a code currently for the GRE. We ask for you to submit a scanned copy to this email address which we keep for our records. Since it is not a requirement  and there is no formal cutoff score for the GRE we do not release or track student information. Only submit your GRE score if you believe it will fill a hole in your transcript and prove your quantitative prowess. 

 The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market.

column1:
RE: Inquiry to Studying at Northwestern University^Hello Nahuel:

The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition. They are awarded during the application process to select students.

In addition to the fellowships offered directly through the program
column2:
Master of Science in Analytics students may be eligible for other types of support. Excellent resources may be found at the McCormick School of Engineering Fellowships and Internships <http://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/graduates/current_student_resources/fellowships_internships/index.html>  page or at Northwestern University's Office of Fellowships <http://www.northwestern.edu/fellowships/> 

Students in the Master of Science in Analytics program are eligible for financial aid. Prospective students should familiarize themselves with the alternatives for financial aid <http://www.tgs.northwestern.edu/financial-aid/student-loans/index.html>  and contact Student Financial Services <http://www.northwestern.edu/sfs/contact_us/index.html>  with any questions.

Students utilizing financial aid to fund their graduate degree must comply with the Financial Aid Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) Policy <http://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/graduates/current_student_resources/index.html>  to maintain eligibility.



Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

RE: Can I use IELTS score apply Master of Science in Analytics^Dear Eric:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction
column3: so
column4: you would not be required to submit scores. Test scores must be less than two years old at the date of matriculation. The minimum acceptable score for the TOEFL is 95 (Internet based test) and for the IELTS
column5:
7.5. Our TOEFL code is 3144. 

 

Either the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission. Admissions for this program is very competitive
column6: we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column7: so industry experience
column9: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column10: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column11:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year.

 

For more information regarding our specific application requirements I encourage you to explore our program website at  <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/> http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/ and keep in touch on twitter xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: For information^Dear Cao:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2: we do not expect incoming students to be fluent in Java
column3: we provide the course so that our students develop a better understanding of Java and all of the tools you will be using in your course projects. Your experience with Python will provide a strong advantage
column4:
we like to see students who have IT experience. 

 

To answer your question regarding financial support
column5: we do not provide teaching or research assistant positions in our program. The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column6: no additional applications will need to be submitted for consideration. For more information in regards to financial aid and funding
column7: I encourage you to explore those possibilities on our website
column8:
linked  <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> here.

 

Either the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission. Admissions for this program is very competitive

RE: Application Questions^Dear Vikas:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Either the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission

column9:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year.

column10: the MSiA program is full-time for 15 months (including a required summer industry-focused internship). There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column12:

column1:
RE: Questions about my application^Hello Mike.

 

I apologize for not responding to your inquiry in a more timely fashion. Unfortunately
column2:
due to the high number of emails we have received over the last few days we have been focused on uploading any additional files and compiling applicant packets. I am now seeing your question concerning GMAT scores and I notice we have not received your GMAT score from GMAC. I have gone through our files since the beginning of the academic year and somehow yours was not reported to our program. 

 

Would you be able to download your unofficial GMAT score from the GMAC website and email that to me at your earliest convenience. I am in the process of making your applicant packet for the admissions committee. Your material will not be marked as late and I will be sure to attach it to your file once I receive your score. I apologize for any confusion.

 

In regards to your second question
column3:
we have received all three of your letters of reference.

 

I hope you have a wonderful weekend and I apologize for bothering on a Sunday.

 

Regards

column1:
RE: Masters Program at Northwestern University (Fall '14)^Dear Nandini:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. I would be happy to answer your questions. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

I am very sorry to say that because of the high volume of application weve received this admissions season
column8: we are unable to accommodate on-campus visits between now and our admissions decisions. Should you still want to plan a visit to campus and an opportunity to sit in on several classes after March 17
column9: we would be happy to assist.\r\n\r\nIn the interim
column10: I would be happy to schedule a 10 -15 minute call with you and the associate director to answer any questions that you might have about the program. Please let me know if this would be helpful. In regards to an information session
column11:
we will not be hosting another one during this application season. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column16:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Finance
column25:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column26: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column27: and the deadline will be in February 15
column28:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column29:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: Interest in MSiA^Dear Marisa:

 

Thank you for reaching out to me with your questions concerning the Master of Science in Analytics program here at Northwestern University. 

 

To answer your question concerning our GPA minimum
column2:
the 3.0 is a hard minimum. We use it as our first benchmark when we are shortlisting candidates. 

 

When you are comparing our program with the MS in Predictive Analytics outside of the full-time/part-time factor
column3: the other big difference is our industry projects. Here in the MSiA program since we are full time
column4:
we expect our students to carry a full class load paired with a 9-month practicum project. The practicum project is an industry supplied project which students use to work with real-world data to solve problems and analyze for companies. Class work is similar but the project and networking included in our program sets us up to fulfill a business need along with the analytics. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions concerning NU and our application process.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1:
RE: Application Questions^Dear Alice;
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

Please see below for answers to your two questions:
1. With regards to your TOEFL score
column2: you will not need to submit a TOEFL score as long as the degree granting institution (Univ. of Michigan) is an English speaking institution. \r\n2. Unfortunately
column3: we currently do not offer a PhD in Analytics. We only provide the MS degree. If you are looking to go into academia with analytics
column4: the IEMS department here at Northwestern offers an Analytics focus. That may be a better fit for you if you are looking to get a PhD. Currently
column5:
I do not know of any institutions which offers Analytics as a field for PhD's. 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column6: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column7: and the deadline will be in February 15
column8: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session today  at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1: RE: MSiA Transcript and GMAT scores^Hello Mariela
column2: I apologize for the delayed response time from our department. I have just gone into our application managing system and I see that your application is completed but was never submitted. We received just under 600 applications this year and we have over 800 opened applications. Due to the turnaround of our admission decisions we did not look at any applications that were not submitted. We are aware of the clunky and archaic application system
column3:
and we are planning to use a different application system which is more user friendly. It appears as though you have completed your application and had not selected the Submit function which would take your application from N/A to and Active application. 

 

That being said
column4: we have sent out our decisions and are close to hearing back from all of our admitted students
column5:
and we have a full waitlist and will not be able to offer you a place in our 2014 class. I apologize for both the delay in our response back to you and the inconvenience. I can pass you application file to our admissions committee prior to waitlist discussion and they can determine your admissions status at this point. We will look to have an answer for you soon. 

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: Full time and Part time programs^Dear Rob;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your questions
column2: the MSiA program is full-time for 15 months (including a required summer industry-focused internship). There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column3: however
column4:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/ <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/> 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column5: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience
column7: strong test scores
column9: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column10:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column12: and the deadline will be in February 15
column13:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column14:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column15:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1: RE: MASTER OF SCIENCE IN DATA ANALYTICS^Dear Nidhi
column2:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions
column3: the MSiA program is full-time for 15 months (including a required summer industry-focused internship). There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column5:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/ <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/>  

 

In regards to placement after graduating
column6: we have just graduated our first class! We have sent out a survey and are awaiting all the responses to provide you this information. We will update our website with this information once we have an official count. With regards to work in Big Data
column7:
I encourage you to look at our curriculum and courses to see if you would benefit from taking courses with us in Big Data. I have linked our webpage here <http://analytics-dev.tech.northwestern.edu/curriculum/index.html> . 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column8: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: so industry experience
column12: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column13:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column18:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column22:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 22% Information Technology
column25: 6% Academia
column26: 6% Finance
column27:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column28: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column29: and the deadline will be in February 15
column30:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column31:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

RE: graduate program admission requirements^Dear Xuecong:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2: my recommendation is to site those upcoming courses in your resume or your personal statement. In order for your application to be guaranteed to be complete and read by our admission committee
column3:
it would be easiest for you to include it in one of those two documents.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

column1: RE: Northwestern Analytics: Application Deadline Reminder ^Dear Jaideep
column2: Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question concerning references
column3: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column4: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column5:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

Professional

0

3

0

1-3

2

1

3-5

1

2

5+

0

3

 

 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to reviewing your application for Fall 2014!

column1: RE: Master of Science in Analytics deadline inquiry^Hello John:\r\n\r\nI apologize for my delayed response time. We do look for our students to have some background in computer science. It seems as though you have knowledge of CS and I would be sure to mention it either on your resume or in your personal statement. The other way to have CS appear on your transcript is by taking classes such as CORESERA and including certificates from their programs in your resume. I believe you have an understanding of CS and that will help you application. We also run a 2 week boot camp at the university
column2: where our students are trained how to use SAS
column3: SQL
column5: Cognos
column6:
Tableau etc. 

Please let me know what other questions you may have about our admissions process.

column1:
RE: Full time and Part time programs^Dear Rob;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your questions
column2: the MSiA program is full-time for 15 months (including a required summer industry-focused internship). There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column3: however
column4:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/ <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/> 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column5: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience
column7: strong test scores
column9: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column10:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column12: and the deadline will be in February 15
column13:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column14:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column15:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: Applying to Master of Science in Analytics^Dear Monika;
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

1. Please email us a scanned copy of the transcript to this email account. 
2. We do not require official transcripts until admitted into the program.
3. Official TOEFL scores are compulsory and should be sent to us via ETS at 3144. And If you chose to submit a GRE score
column2: please send via 3672.\r\n\r\nBoth GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15
column25: 2014. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26: we are looking forward to having your brother as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!\r\nVictoria L. Richmond\r\nProgram Assistant 3

column1:
RE: Enquiry - M.S. in Analytics^Dear Krushnan

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

To answer your question
column8: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction. We accept scanned transcripts for the application process
column9: and should you be accepted
column10: it would be an acceptance contingent on receiving original transcripts from each of your degree-granting institutions. Test scores must be less than two years old at the date of matriculation (for the 2014-15 cohort
column12: 2014). The minimum acceptable score for the TOEFL is 85 (Internet based test) and for the IELTS
column13:
7.0. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column18:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column22:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 22% Information Technology
column25: 6% Academia
column26: 6% Finance
column27:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column28: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column29: and the deadline will be in February 15
column30:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column31:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Either the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission. Admissions for this program is very competitive

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market.

column3: we are housed within the Engineering school at Northwestern
column4:

For more information from Northwestern in regards to STEM please go to the following link <http://www.northwestern.edu/international/living-working/student-employment/optional-practical-training/stem-extension-opt.html> . 

 

Either the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission. The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants

column1: RE: Automatic reply: GRE requirements^Hello Kathleen
column2:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions
column3: the MSiA program is full-time for 15 months (including a required summer industry-focused internship). There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column5:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column6: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
