column1:
RE: Request for Information - M.S. in Data Science^Dear Naman;

 

I apologize for the delay in my response time to your inquiry. To answer your question
column2: we are unable to accept students at any time outside of a fall start. Due to the nature of our program our students work as a cohort. They enter the year together and begin a 9month practicum project which ties into course work throughout their first 3 quarters. There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column3: however
column4:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here:  <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/> http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/

 

Please let me know if you have any remaining questions.

 

Happy New Years and Good Luck in 2014.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

RE: Request for Information on the Master of Science in Analytics program^Dear Shalini

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Master of Science in Analytics tuition for the 2013-2014 academic year will be $15
column2: 038 per quarter. Tuition is due for the fall
column3:
winter and spring quarters but not the summer.  

Additional expenses should be considered:

          On campus annual cost of living expenses of $22
column5: \r\n\r\n          Approximately $500-$1
column6: 000 for textbooks
column7: \r\n\r\n          $3
column9: \r\n\r\n          $5
column12: etc). \r\n\r\nThe total cost of the Master of Science in Analytics degree will be about $85
column14:
000 depending on the student's needs. 

 

To answer your questions concerning financial aid The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column15: no additional applications will need to be submitted for consideration. In addition to the fellowships offered directly through the program
column16:
Master of Science in Analytics students may be eligible for other types of support. Resources may be found at the McCormick School of Engineering  <http://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/graduates/current_student_resources/fellowships_internships/index.html> Fellowships and Internships page or at Northwestern University's  <http://www.northwestern.edu/fellowships/> Office of Fellowships

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column17: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column21: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column22:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

column27:

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None

column3:

column1:
RE: from an interested applicant^Dear Jeffery

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

To answer your question
column8: as long as you include all of your experience with calculus and computer science our admissions committee will be able to evaluate you with that in mind
column9: even if it isnt represented in your transcripts. In terms of prerequisites we do not require linear algebra
column10:
but it helps candidates who have had exposure to it.  

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column15:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column19:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column25: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column26: and the deadline will be in February 15
column27:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column28:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

RE: Application Deadline^Dear Rohan;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question; we do not accept students on a rolling admissions. We will not begin reviewing applications until after February 15th. No matter when you submit your application (as long as all of your materials arrive before the deadline) you will be given an equal advantage of all our applicants. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

RE: Application Questions^Hello Xiang:

 

If that is the way your University prefers to handle transcripts we entirely understand. If you could mail us the transcript in an envelope (such as FedEx or DHL) sealed then that is acceptable to our program. 

 

However
column2:
for your application you only need to submit scanned transcripts from your university. You do not need to submit the original documents unless youre admitted to the program. If it is easier for you to email me a scanned copy do not feel pressured to mail us the originals. 

 

I hope this answers your question

column1: RE: graduate school application^Dear Chen:\r\n\r\nThank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2: we do not require a TOEFL from you if your degree was issued by Purdue University. As long as the degree granting institution uses English as the primary language your fluency requirement is satisfied. We do not require Financial evidence upon applying. If you believe the courses at a community college will help bolster your application
column3:
I encourage you to submit those transcripts. Some students will supplement their undergraduate degree with quantitative classes or computer science classes and then include them in the application. 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column5: Gender mix: Male 69%
column6: Female 31%
column7: Nationality: US 62.5%
column8: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column9: 28% Economics and Social Sciences
column12: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column17: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 16
column19: and the deadline will be in February 15
column20: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

column1:
RE: Information requested^Dear Premanand

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

To answer your question
column2:
yes. You are an excellent candidate for MSiA. We have a wide range of students enrolled in our program. We have students coming straight from their undergraduate degree and others who have up to 10 years' experience in industry.  

 The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15
column25: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

-----Original Message-----
From: premanand tiwari xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: Inquiry to Studying at Northwestern University^Hello Nahuel:

The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition. They are awarded during the application process to select students.

In addition to the fellowships offered directly through the program
column2:
Master of Science in Analytics students may be eligible for other types of support. Excellent resources may be found at the McCormick School of Engineering Fellowships and Internships <http://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/graduates/current_student_resources/fellowships_internships/index.html>  page or at Northwestern University's Office of Fellowships <http://www.northwestern.edu/fellowships/> 

Students in the Master of Science in Analytics program are eligible for financial aid. Prospective students should familiarize themselves with the alternatives for financial aid <http://www.tgs.northwestern.edu/financial-aid/student-loans/index.html>  and contact Student Financial Services <http://www.northwestern.edu/sfs/contact_us/index.html>  with any questions.

Students utilizing financial aid to fund their graduate degree must comply with the Financial Aid Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) Policy <http://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/graduates/current_student_resources/index.html>  to maintain eligibility.



Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1:
Inquiry-MS Analytics^Hello Hemdara:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I have seen your CV and read a little about your background and work experience. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question about admittance in spring
column2:
we are not structured for that time frame. Our program is a full-time 15month program which begins in the fall. We require all students in the 32 person cohort to begin in the fall because of our 8month Industry sponsored project. Students begin working on that in teams of 4 from day 1 of class. Due to this partnership we do not allow students to enter in the spring quarter. 

 

However
column3:
you appear to be a very eager candidate with qualifications for our program and we would love to see your application for Fall 2014. We will begin in September and then graduate the following December 2015. The unique nature of our program will benefit you greatly.  

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column5: Gender mix: Male 69%
column6: Female 31%
column7: Nationality: US 62.5%
column8:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column9: 28% Economics and Social Sciences
column12:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column17:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column19: and the deadline will be in February 15
column20:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column2: The Master of Science in Analytics will admit only 32 of students each fall quarter. While this will undoubtedly mean that admission will be highly selective
column3: it will also mean we can give appropriate attention to those who are admitted. column1:
RE: Inquiries of Master of Science in Analytics^Dear Erica;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions please see below:

1.       We will waive your TOEFL/IELTS requirement
column2: please provide me with a link to your schools website where they state that English is the language of instruction. \r\n\r\n2.       We do not have any pre-requisites for our course
column3: we look for applicants who have a background in quantitative courses (statistics
column5: linear algebra etc) and some IT/programming background.\r\n\r\n3.       To answer your question regarding financial support
column6: the Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column7: no additional applications will need to be submitted for consideration. For more information in regards to financial aid and funding
column8: I encourage you to explore those possibilities on our website
column9: linked  <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> here.\r\n\r\n4.       In regards to your GRE score
column10:
please email us your unofficial scores and I will attach that to your file. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column11: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column15: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column16:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column21:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column24: 13% Business and Management Sciences
column25:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column26: 28% Consulting and Professional Services
column27: 22% Information Technology
column28: 6% Academia

column30:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

column2:
we have received your application fee. We use a third party to collect our application fees and there is a delay between the two systems. We do not update the student checklists until the Monday of each week. I have manually adjusted your account to show that you have paid. 

 

With regard to your GRE score
column3: we have not received it at our office as of today
column5:
when ETS sends out scores they bundle them in one large packet. Due to the recent bad weather here in the United States we have had a delay in our mail delivery. My advice is for you to email us a PDF from the ETS website which acknowledges your scores (if the best you can find is a screen shot) I will attach this to your file until your original score arrives. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question about our scholarship options; we offer a limited number of fellowships to applicants. These fellowships will pay for fifty percent (50%) of tuition costs for the 4 quarters you are taking classes on campus. We determine who receives those fellowships solely on merit. Your application to our program is the means that we evaluate candidates for fellowships. There are additional funding opportunities at Northwestern University
column2: but we do not have any input or control over those scholarships. I have linked our page on Tuition and Fees <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html>  from our website
column3:
which provides more contacts for tuition funding here at Northwestern.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). Many applicants will provide their GRE scores as proof of their quantitative background
column5: I would recommend you submit your scores if you believe it will strengthen your application. The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience
column7: strong test scores
column9: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column10:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column15:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column19:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the  <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html> registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1: RE: MSiA Program^Dear Richard
column2: Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column3: unfortunately
column4:
we have a very short turn around for applications. We pass off completed applications to our admissions committee the following week and there is not a lot of room in regards for late materials. 

 

That being said
column5: we do have a few policies which will allow you to complete your application rather quickly. We do not request official transcripts while in the application process
column6: we only ask for official mailed and sealed transcripts after you have been accepted to the program. The same idea applies to any additional materials (GRE/TOEFL scores
column7: which are not required) we only ask for a PDF of your scores. In regards to your Letters of Recommendation
column8:
my advice is that you tell them it is a rushed letter and they can email the letter to this address when it is finished and I will attach it until your application is passed to the admissions committee. 

 

Please let me know if you have additional questions to this information.

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1: RE: Master of Science in Analytics deadline inquiry^Hello John:\r\n\r\nI apologize for my delayed response time. We do look for our students to have some background in computer science. It seems as though you have knowledge of CS and I would be sure to mention it either on your resume or in your personal statement. The other way to have CS appear on your transcript is by taking classes such as CORESERA and including certificates from their programs in your resume. column2: where our students are trained how to use SAS

column1:
RE: admissions^Dear Sumeet;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question concerning the GRE; neither the GRE nor the GMAT are required for admission to the Master of Science in Analytics but we will accept scores from applicants who choose to provide them to us. We believe we can draw enough information from the remainder of an application package to make an assessment of a candidate's suitability for the program. In some cases
column2: supplying a standardized test score may be recommended
column3: particularly in instances where a high score might be indicative of abilities not demonstrated elsewhere in the application. During admissions for the 2013-14 cohort
column4: approximately 75% of candidates provided scores. Unfortunately
column5: we cannot accept any additional materials after Feb 15th. We have a very small window of time for our reviewers to evaluate applicants before they are provided offer letters
column6: therefore we will be creating student applicant packets for completed applications directly after the 15th. Your application is complete without you sitting for the GMAT. \r\n\r\nIn regards to your question concerning your transcripts from India
column7: we do not require official transcripts until after you have been admitted to the program. Our admissions committee can evaluate scanned pdf copies of your transcript. Due to the approaching deadline
column8:
I would recommend you to email us at  xxx@xxx.xxx xxx@xxx.xxx 

Follow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxx 

 

From: Sumeet Aneja xxx@xxx.xxx You must submit official
column9:
sealed transcripts mailed directly from the University to the MAP office

 

 

Thanks

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. I would be happy to answer your questions. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program

column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

I am very sorry to say that because of the high volume of application weve received this admissions season
column8: we are unable to accommodate on-campus visits between now and our admissions decisions. Should you still want to plan a visit to campus and an opportunity to sit in on several classes after March 17
column9: we would be happy to assist.\r\n\r\nIn the interim
column10: I would be happy to schedule a 10 -15 minute call with you and the associate director to answer any questions that you might have about the program. Please let me know if this would be helpful. In regards to an information session

column1:
RE: Reg acceptance into the MS analytics program^Dear Varsha:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

For more information on our current students please visit the current student page on our website.

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

column1: RE: Northwestern Analytics: Application Deadline Reminder ^Dear Jaideep
column2: Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question concerning references
column3: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column4: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column5:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 


Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

Professional

3

0


1-3

2

1


3-5

1

2


5+

0

3

column1:
RE: Full time and Part time programs^Dear Rob;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your questions
column2: the MSiA program is full-time for 15 months (including a required summer industry-focused internship). There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column3: however
column4:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here:  <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/> http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column5: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience
column7: strong test scores
column9: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column10:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column12: and the deadline will be in February 15
column13:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column2:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program

column1: RE: MSiA Prospective student question^Dear Shiva;\r\n\r\nThank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I would love to answer your questions
column2:
I apologize for the delay in our response time. 

 

Please see below for answers to your questions; 

1.       With regards to anything related to visas we suggest students to research the Northwestern University Internationals Offices website. They have an entire staff focused on all of the laws and rules associated with visas. We prefer not to provide any advice or information in this regard in case we do not give you correct information. Their website is linked here.

2.       Each student will complete 3 industry provided projects while they attend our program. Our Practicum project and Capstone project are not paid projects for the students. These are used to learn and develop your skills to make you successful in the workplace. They are paired with your classes and you will learn and develop skills to accompany these projects. However
column3: you are able to negotiate your payment for the internship in the summer quarter. We allow students to choose any internship they would like in any industry (as long as it fulfills an analytics requirement) and they negotiate their summer salary.\r\n\r\n3.       In regards to selection of projects
column4:
our director selects 8 companies and company supplied projects for the practicum assignment. Students then apply to us with the projects they would like to work on and we then assign students to one of the projects. Projects cross all industry and fields. 

 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program. We are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014.

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: Question about program application^Dear Roy;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.  To answer your question concerning references
column2: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column3: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column4:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 


Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

Professional


0

3

0


1-3

2

1


3-5

1

2


5+

0

3

 

It is left to your discretion who writes your letters of reference. We will accept mailed letters as long as they reach our office by the deadline of February 15th. It would be quickest for your recommender to email us an electronic version
column5: however
column6:
we do understand there is a preference for a mailed letter of reference. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column7:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: Inquiring about MS in Analytics program^Dear Ayushi:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  Since we do not require the GRE we do not maintain a record of the average GRE score. We encourage applicants to include their score if it will strengthen our understanding or your quantitative background. The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants

column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. column2: the cost of $15
column3: 000 per quarter are for the four quarters you are taking classes at Northwestern
column4: therefore it does not include the period when you are in your summer internship. Our students typically find summer internships which are paid and therefore have a source of income to offset the tuition cost during the summer. We provide a great deal of help to our students when it comes to the internship. Many students enter the program with an idea of what field of analytics they would like to go into
column5: and therefore we set up opportunities for them to interview. We also send out a resume book which allows companies to view our students and contact them. But you are required to have an internship in our program.\r\n\r\nBoth GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program

RE: Master of Sc. in Analytics^Dear Yoong:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 


Please see below for answers to your questions:

1. We began our program in 2012
column2: and on Thursday
column3: December 12th we graduated our first cohort. \r\n\r\n2. We accept 32 students each year into our program
column4:
we do not anticipate expanding the number of students accepted in the near future. 

3. We are entirely separate from the School of Continuing Studies. We do not share faculty or courses. The SCSs MS in Predictive Analytics is a part time program which allows students to take classes online and finish their degree on their schedule. Our program is a full time Professional Masters program which requires you to take our classes (with some flexibility) and finish within 15months. The hallmark feature of our program is our industry collaboration. We require our students to complete 3 industry sponsored projects which they will take alongside their class work. 

4. In regards to your resume
column5:
I have included a student profile breakdown below. Our students have a wide variety of academic backgrounds. You exposure to computer science in industry will translate in your resume and provide you with the necessary IT background for this program. 

5. We will not be able to accept your GRE score. We close our applications on February 15th and evaluate our applicants and provide our decisions on March 18th. It is not a requirement and your application will be reviewed by our committee. 

6. We provide a merit based fellowship
column6: which will cover 50% of your tuition fee. There is no additional material required to apply for the fellowship. We use your general program application as an application for our fellowship. I encourage you to research more funding opportunities on our website
column7:
<http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> linked here. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column8: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: so industry experience
column12: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column13:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column18:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science

3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None

column25: 6% Academia

4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

column1:
RE: Inquiry to Studying at Northwestern University^Hello Nahuel:

The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition. They are awarded during the application process to select students.

In addition to the fellowships offered directly through the program
column2:
Master of Science in Analytics students may be eligible for other types of support. Excellent resources may be found at the McCormick School of Engineering  <http://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/graduates/current_student_resources/fellowships_internships/index.html> Fellowships and Internships page or at Northwestern University's  <http://www.northwestern.edu/fellowships/> Office of Fellowships

Students in the Master of Science in Analytics program are eligible for financial aid. Prospective students should familiarize themselves with the  <http://www.tgs.northwestern.edu/financial-aid/student-loans/index.html> alternatives for financial aid and  <http://www.northwestern.edu/sfs/contact_us/index.html> contact Student Financial Services with any questions.

Students utilizing financial aid to fund their graduate degree must comply with the  <http://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/graduates/current_student_resources/index.html> Financial Aid Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) Policy to maintain eligibility.



Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1:
RE: Information Regarding doctoral program^Hello Avdhut:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

 

To answer your question we do not have a doctoral program in Analytics at this time. Our Industrial Engineering and Management Studies PhD allows for their students to have an analytics minor associated with their doctoral program. This is a relatively new field and I do not know of many programs which offer a pure Analytics PhD program. The IEMS graduate program is linked here <http://www.iems.northwestern.edu/> . 



Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

column1:
RE: Admission query^Dear Trupti:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

 

To answer your question
column2: we do not require a GRE score be submitted by every applicant. Only 70% of our admitted students provided their scores. Therefore
column3:
we do not release our average score since it is not an equal representation of our students.  Submit your score if you feel that it helps your application and provides us with a fair understanding of your quantitative background. 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science

3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None

4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

RE: Interested in MS in Analytics^Dear Khurram Ali Kahn:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question about setting up an appointment to discuss our program and admission process
column2:
my first recommendation is for you to sign up for out information session for November 15th at Noon CT. I have included the link below. This session is designed to answer your questions and give you insight into our program. We will discuss everything from application process to financial options. Our Associate Director will lead the discussion and then open the last 15mins to Q&A. If you have additional questions beyond that information session we will schedule a 15min phone call.  

 

To provide you with some common questions we have about admissions please see below:

1.       We do not enroll based on rolling admissions. We wait until applications have closed and then a panel will review the applicants. Candidates typically will not hear from our committee until February. 

2.       Out of the 32 candidates we select the top students for our fellowship
column3:
we have limited fellowships available and they are solely given on merit based. You do not need to fill out any further material for consideration for our fellowships. 

3.       The GRE is not a required component of our admissions process. Because we do not require it we do not have a true average for our enrolled students scores. 

4.       You need only provide pdf copies of  transcripts and any supplemental material (ie TOEFL
column5:
etc). Upon admittance to the program.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program

Inquiry-MS Analytics^Hello Hemdara:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I have seen your CV and read a little about your background and work experience. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question about admittance in spring
column2:
we are not structured for that time frame. Our program is a full-time 15month program which begins in the fall. We require all students in the 32 person cohort to begin in the fall because of our 8month Industry sponsored project. Students begin working on that in teams of 4 from day 1 of class. Due to this partnership we do not allow students to enter in the spring quarter. 

 

However
column3:
you appear to be a very eager candidate with qualifications for our program and we would love to see your application for Fall 2014. We will begin in September and then graduate the following December 2015. The unique nature of our program will benefit you greatly.

column1:
RE: Question regarding application references^Dear Max:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

To answer your questions about letters of recommendation please see below: 

We require 3 letters of recommendation from people who have had supervisory experience over you in a professional and/or academic setting. 

All writers are asked to address the following questions:

*	how they know the candidate and why they are qualified to assess the candidate's suitability for the program;
*	if they can identify any distinctive qualities and/or examples which highlight the candidate's suitability for the program;
*	if they can provide some point of comparison for the candidate against others who were in similar circumstances.

We have a preference for letters of recommendation come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column2: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column3:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 


 Years since completed undergraduate 

  Academic  

  Professional 


0

3

0


1-3

2

1


3-5

1

2


5+

0

3

The application system will email your recommenders at the email address you provide. Recommenders will receive a request to address the questions outlined above as well as instructions on how to upload their completed letter into the application system. Recommenders may use standard word processing software for letters.

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column5: and the deadline will be in February 15
column6:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the  <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html> registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column7:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Thanks

column1:
RE: For information^Dear Cao:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2: we do not expect incoming students to be fluent in Java
column3: we provide the course so that our students develop a better understanding of Java and all of the tools you will be using in your course projects. Your experience with Python will provide a strong advantage
column4:
we like to see students who have IT experience. 

 

To answer your question regarding financial support
column5: we do not provide teaching or research assistant positions in our program. The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column6: no additional applications will need to be submitted for consideration. For more information in regards to financial aid and funding
column7: I encourage you to explore those possibilities on our website
column8:
linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> .

 

Either the GRE or GMAT test score is required for admission. Admissions for this program is very competitive

column1:
Northwestern Analytics - Admissions Status^Dear Hao: 

 

Thank you for your patience during the admissions process. Northwestern Universitys Master of Science in Analytics Admissions Committee has completed evaluation of waitlist candidates for the class of 2015. I regret to inform you that after our first round of admission
column2:
we are unable to offer you a position in the class. 

 

We hope that you will understand that this decision is not a reflection of your abilities
column3: but rather a reflection of the exceedingly high numbers we saw from this years application pool. During this admissions season
column4: we saw a record number of over five hundred and fifty candidates apply to the entering cohort of thirty-two students. The majority of applicants could have been successful academically
column5:
but our committee was tasked with choosing a small class from a much larger applicant pool than our program had room to admit. 

 

We very much appreciate the interest you have shown in the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University and wish you the best for the coming year.

 

Sincerely
column6:
The Master of Science in Analytics Admissions Committee

 

^Victoria L Richmond^/o=nuexch/ou=Exchange Administrative Group xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
Northwestern Analytics - Application Status^Dear Pavan;

 

Thank you for your patience during the admissions process. Northwestern Universitys Master of Science in Analytics Admissions Committee has completed evaluation of waitlist candidates for the class of 2015. I regret to inform you that after our first round of admission
column2:
we are unable to offer you a position in the class. 

 

We hope that you will understand that this decision is not a reflection of your abilities
column3: but rather a reflection of the exceedingly high numbers we saw from this years application pool. During this admissions season
column4: we saw a record number of over five hundred and fifty candidates apply to the entering cohort of thirty-two students. The majority of applicants could have been successful academically
column5:
but our committee was tasked with choosing a small class from a much larger applicant pool than our program had room to admit. 

 

We very much appreciate the interest you have shown in the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University and wish you the best for the coming year.

 

Sincerely
column6:
The Master of Science in Analytics Admissions Committee

Thank you for your patience in admissions process. Northwestern Universitys Master of Science in Analytics Admissions Committee has completed evaluation of waitlist candidates for the class of 2015. I regret to inform you that after our first round of admission
column2:
we are unable to offer you a position in the class. 

 

We hope that you will understand that this decision is not a reflection of your abilities
column3: but rather a reflection of the exceedingly high numbers we saw from this years application pool. During this admissions season
column4: we saw a record number of over five hundred and fifty candidates apply to the entering cohort of thirty-two students. The majority of applicants could have been successful academically
column5:
but our committee was tasked with choosing a small class from a much larger applicant pool than our program had room to admit. 

 

We very much appreciate the interest you have shown in the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University and wish you the best for the coming year.

 

Sincerely
column6:
The Master of Science in Analytics Admissions Committee

 

 

 

^Master of Science in Analytics^/o=nuexch/ou=Exchange Administrative Group xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1: RE: Northwestern Analytics: Deposit & Wire Transfer Instructions^Hello Ruijing
column2:
I apologize I missed your question regarding the diplomas. We only require official transcripts to matriculate you into the Northwestern University System. We do not require your diplomas. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions or if you require any assistance. 

 

Warm Regards
column3:
Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column4:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd
column5: E278\r\n\r\nEvanston
column6:
IL 60208

T: 847.467.4520

F: 847.491.8005

 

Follow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx 

 

Best Wishes & Kind Regards
column7:
Ruijing Shi 

 

 

 

 

 

2014-03-27 3:12 GMT+08:00 Master of Science in Analytics xxx@xxx.xxx xxx@xxx.xxx If you would like to use this payment option

Northwestern Analytics - Application Status^Dear Yichen:

 

Thank you for your patience in admissions process. Northwestern Universitys Master of Science in Analytics Admissions Committee has completed evaluation of waitlist candidates for the class of 2015. I regret to inform you that after our first round of admission
column2:
we are unable to offer you a position in the class. 

 

We hope that you will understand that this decision is not a reflection of your abilities
column3: but rather a reflection of the exceedingly high numbers we saw from this years application pool. During this admissions season
column4: we saw a record number of over five hundred and fifty candidates apply to the entering cohort of thirty-two students. The majority of applicants could have been successful academically
column5:
but our committee was tasked with choosing a small class from a much larger applicant pool than our program had room to admit. 

 

We very much appreciate the interest you have shown in the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University and wish you the best for the coming year.

 

Sincerely
column6:
The Master of Science in Analytics Admissions Committee

 

 

 

 

^Master of Science in Analytics^/o=nuexch/ou=Exchange Administrative Group xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: Application Problem^Dear Jesse

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2:
if you could provide an official website or statement from the university that English is the main language of your institution. I will mark it in your student account as a note.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15
column25:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column27:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column29:
IL 60208

F: 847.491.8005

RE: Admission In-query from Yi Chun Chien^Dear Yi Chun Chien;

 

I apologize for the delay in our response time. This year we received just under 600 applications for our program
column2: a record number. Unfortunately
column3:
due to the limited number of available seats in our class we were unable to offer you a position for the 2015 cohort. We look for students with high quantitative scores and a background in IT. 

 

To answer your second question
column5:
we do not offer Spring enrollment in our program. Due to the required year-long industry supplied project we cannot accept students half way through the project work. 

 

Please let me know what additional questions you may have and I would be happy to help. 

 

Warm Regards

column1: RE: Automatic reply: GRE requirements^Hello Kathleen
column2:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions
column3: the MSiA program is full-time for 15 months (including a required summer industry-focused internship). There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column5:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column6: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column7: so industry experience
column9: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column10: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column11:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column16:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Finance
column25:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 2014. I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2015!

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: Masters Program at Northwestern University (Fall '14)^Dear Nandini:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. I would be happy to answer your questions. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

I am very sorry to say that because of the high volume of application weve received this admissions season
column8: we are unable to accommodate on-campus visits between now and our admissions decisions. Should you still want to plan a visit to campus and an opportunity to sit in on several classes after March 17
column9: we would be happy to assist.\r\n\r\nIn the interim
column10: I would be happy to schedule a 10 -15 minute call with you and the associate director to answer any questions that you might have about the program. Please let me know if this would be helpful. In regards to an information session
column11:
we will not be hosting another one during this application season. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column16:

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20:

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None

4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

column1:
RE: Masters Program at Northwestern University (Fall '14)^Dear Nandini:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. I would be happy to answer your questions. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

I am very sorry to say that because of the high volume of application weve received this admissions season
column8: we are unable to accommodate on-campus visits between now and our admissions decisions. Should you still want to plan a visit to campus and an opportunity to sit in on several classes after March 17
column9: we would be happy to assist.\r\n\r\nIn the interim
column10: I would be happy to schedule a 10 -15 minute call with you and the associate director to answer any questions that you might have about the program. Please let me know if this would be helpful. In regards to an information session
column11:
we will not be hosting another one during this application season. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20:

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Finance

4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

2014.

column1:
RE: Application Questions^Dear Alice;
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

Please see below for answers to your two questions:
1. With regards to your TOEFL score
column2: you will not need to submit a TOEFL score as long as the degree granting institution (Univ. of Michigan) is an English speaking institution. \r\n2. Unfortunately
column3: we currently do not offer a PhD in Analytics. We only provide the MS degree. If you are looking to go into academia with analytics
column4: the IEMS department here at Northwestern offers an Analytics focus. That may be a better fit for you if you are looking to get a PhD. Currently
column5:
I do not know of any institutions which offers Analytics as a field for PhD's. 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column6: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column7: and the deadline will be in February 15
column8: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session today  at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column9:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Please let me know if you have any other questions

Victoria L. Richmond
Program Assistant

RE: Northwestern University Master of Science in Analytics Program^Dear Tejaswini;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us at the MS in Analytics program at Northwestern University. In regards to your TOEFL score
column2:
my recommendation is to provide us with an ecopy the moment your TOEFL score has been issued. We can upload your ecopy until the official scores comes to our office. 

 

I am confused by your second question
column3: we do not provide teaching or research assistant positions in our program. The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column4: no additional applications will need to be submitted for consideration. For more information in regards to financial aid and funding
column5: I encourage you to explore those possibilities on our website
column6:

column1:
RE: Application Questions^Dear Alice;
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

Please see below for answers to your two questions:
1. With regards to your TOEFL score
column2: you will not need to submit a TOEFL score as long as the degree granting institution (Univ. of Michigan) is an English speaking institution. \r\n2. Unfortunately
column3: we currently do not offer a PhD in Analytics. We only provide the MS degree. If you are looking to go into academia with analytics
column4: the IEMS department here at Northwestern offers an Analytics focus. That may be a better fit for you if you are looking to get a PhD. Currently
column5:
I do not know of any institutions which offers Analytics as a field for PhD's. 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column6: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column7: and the deadline will be in February 15
column8: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session today  at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column9:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Please let me know if you have any other questions

Victoria L. Richmond
Program Assistant

column1:
RE: Difficulty in completing recommendation Letter- NWU^Dear Hassan;

 

I have noticed in your email your recommender has faxed their letter to (847) 491-8539. This is the general fax for McCormick School of Engineering and it is actually a black hole fax number for general McCormick. As listed in my signature
column3:
in regards to this your recommender must list Attn: MS in Analytics for it to come to our program. 

 

The other option is for your recommender to email our program directly with their recommendation and I can upload your letter of reference from there. We have just received and email from Mohammed A. Al-Shoshan with a letter of reference for you. This letter has been uploaded to your account this morning. 

 

I apologize for the recommendation glitch in our application manager system. We have had a few issues and are looking to upgrade our application system for next year. 

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1: RE: Median salary info request^Hello Stanley
column2:
I apologize for the delay in my response. Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column3: all of the current information we are reporting on is listed on our MSiA Career and Internship Placement information on our website for the graduated class of 2013. I encourage you to look at our career placement statistics and the companies who recruit with our program. However
column4: please check back on our website in the coming weeks
column5:
we will be updating this information and including the data points you are evaluating.  Linked Here. <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/career%20placement.html> 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column6: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column7: so industry experience
column9: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column10: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column11:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column16:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Finance
column25:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 2014. I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2015!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column27:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

F: 847.491.8005 <tel:847.491.8005>

Thanks a lot for your time!

 

 

On Tue
