column1: RE: Median salary info request^Hello Stanley
column2:
I apologize for the delay in my response. Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column3: all of the current information we are reporting on is listed on our MSiA Career and Internship Placement information on our website for the graduated class of 2013. I encourage you to look at our career placement statistics and the companies who recruit with our program. However
column4: please check back on our website in the coming weeks
column5:
we will be updating this information and including the data points you are evaluating.  Linked Here. <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/career%20placement.html> 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column6: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column7: so industry experience
column9: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column10: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column11:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column16:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Finance
column25:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 2014. I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2015!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column27:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd
column28: E278\r\n\r\nEvanston
column29:
IL 60208

T: 847.467.4520 <tel:847.467.4520> 

F: 847.491.8005 <tel:847.491.8005> 

 

Follow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxx 

 

 

 

 

From: Stanley eales xxx@xxx.xxx 

Thanks a lot for your time!

 

 

On Tue

RE: Difficulty in completing recommendation Letter- NWU^Dear Hassan;

 

I have noticed in your email your recommender has faxed their letter to (847) 491-8539. This is the general fax for McCormick School of Engineering and it is actually a black hole fax number for general McCormick. As listed in my signature
column3:
in regards to this your recommender must list Attn: MS in Analytics for it to come to our program. 

 

The other option is for your recommender to email our program directly with their recommendation and I can upload your letter of reference from there. We have just received and email from Mohammed A. Al-Shoshan with a letter of reference for you. This letter has been uploaded to your account this morning. 

 

I apologize for the recommendation glitch in our application manager system. We have had a few issues and are looking to upgrade our application system for next year. 

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1: RE: MSiA Transcript and GMAT scores^Hello Mariela
column2: I apologize for the delayed response time from our department. I have just gone into our application managing system and I see that your application is completed but was never submitted. We received just under 600 applications this year and we have over 800 opened applications. Due to the turnaround of our admission decisions we did not look at any applications that were not submitted. We are aware of the clunky and archaic application system
column3:
and we are planning to use a different application system which is more user friendly. It appears as though you have completed your application and had not selected the Submit function which would take your application from N/A to and Active application. 

 

That being said
column4: we have sent out our decisions and are close to hearing back from all of our admitted students
column5:
and we have a full waitlist and will not be able to offer you a place in our 2014 class. I apologize for both the delay in our response back to you and the inconvenience. I can pass you application file to our admissions committee prior to waitlist discussion and they can determine your admissions status at this point. We will look to have an answer for you soon. 

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column2: I apologize I missed your phone call

I completely understand that our application system is less than user friendly

column2: we are currently unable to accept students during our Spring term on campus (March-June). We only accept students annually to begin in the Fall (Sept). Due to our industry projects we are restricted to only accept our 32 students in one cohort. We require students to complete at 9month practicum project
column3: a 10week internship
column4: followed by a 3month capstone project. Due to the level of group work
column5: we are unable to accept students outside of our first intake. \r\n\r\nWe would be happy to enroll you in our 2015-2016 cohort
column6: however
column7: which is a 15month fulltime program. For more information in regards to financial aid and funding
column8: I encourage you to explore those possibilities on our website
column9:
linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> .

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column10: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column14: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column15:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column20:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column24:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column25: 28% Consulting and Professional Services
column26: 22% Information Technology
column27: 6% Academia
column28: 6% Finance
column29:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 2014. I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column30:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2015!

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

column1: RE: Masters of Science in Analytics^Dear Lawrence
column2:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column3: we have received an increasing number of applications each year since our programs inception. Currently
column4:
we have an acceptance rate just below 10%. We take into consideration your full application and your personal statement would be a welcome place for you to explain your circumstances and your passion for analytics. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column5: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience
column7: strong test scores
column9: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column10:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column15:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column19:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 2014. I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column25:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2016!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column26:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd
column27: E278\r\n\r\nEvanston
column28:
IL 60208

T: 847.467.4520

F: 847.491.8005

 

Follow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxx 

 

 

 

 

From: Lawrence Tsai xxx@xxx.xxx What is the average number of applicants that applies yearly? I would very much like to be part of the MSiA class of 2016
column29:
so my question is how do I best stand out in the upcoming application? 

 

Thank you so much for your time and I look forward to learning more about the MSiA program!

 

Thank you
column30:
Lawrence Tsai  

^Master of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Lawrence xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: MS Analytics Application - Fall 2014^Dear Sahil;

 

I apologize for the confusion. We do not use the GATS system for our applications. We operate outside of the Graduate School and are housed within the Industrial Engineering. Therefore
column2: we use McCormicks MAP system to track the status of applications. However
column3:
we will not be updating the MAP system until decisions are made on March 18th. 

 

If we require a skype interview we will reach out to you in the coming week and schedule an appointment convenient for your schedule. 

 

Regards

column2: The Master of Science in Analytics will admit only 32 of students each fall quarter. While this will undoubtedly mean that admission will be highly selective
column3: it will also mean we can give appropriate attention to those who are admitted. We are aiming to foster a collaborative atmosphere within the program and believe that a small cohort of exceptionally talented and strongly motivated students will best enable us to achieve this. We have received an increase in applications each year since the inception of our program. We have an acceptance rate a little below 10%. \r\n\r\nBoth GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9:
but we do require a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column14: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column18: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column23: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 2014.  I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column24: we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2015!\r\nVictoria L. Richmond\r\nProgram Assistant 3

column1:
RE: Information regarding application material: Abhitab Jain : Applicant to MSiA Program 2014^Dear Abhitab;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us at Northwestern Universitys MS in Analytics program. I apologize for the delay in my response time
column2:
due to applications we were unable to answer student inquiries. 

 

In regards to the application payment
column3: we have received it and I see that it is now shown as paid. We use a third party to collect our application payments here at the university. We receive weekly reports on payment. Our system was a slightly overwhelmed during the final days of applications and there was a slow update on the site. However
column4: we do have the time stamp of payment
column5:
prior to the deadline. 

 

Your transcripts were marked as received on 02/13. I apologize if this is not reflected in your student account
column6:
we are working to replace our application managing system due to technical errors this season. 

 

With regards to your GRE
column7: did you us the 3672 code to send us your GRE score report? Typically
column8: candidates will send it to the general Northwestern Account
column9:
which unfortunately goes to general admissions. Can you provide me with a scanned report from the GRE? 

 

Unfortunately
column10: your letters of reference have still not arrived. Our policy is to have all material in before the deadline of 2/15. If your recommenders submit their letters I can attach them to your application packet
column11:
but we cannot guarantee the same amount of review as applications turned in by the deadline. 

 

Regards

column1: RE: Question From Prospective student ^Hello Stella
column2:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question regard the waiver of your TOEFL score
column3:
as long as one degree granting institution is in English we do not require a TOEFL from you. 

 

And in regards to specific perquisite courses we evaluate applications primarily on an individuals quantitative background.  It is not required
column4: but helpful to have Statistics and Calculus courses on your transcripts. In terms of program knowledge
column5: we host a 2 week comprehensive boot camp where we have industry partners from SAS
column6: SQL
column7: tableau
column8:
etc. come to campus for full-day instruction and informational sessions. You are not required to have a mastery of these programs prior to entering the MSiA program.

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15
column25:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: JUNTAO YAO xxx@xxx.xxx I await your reply! 

 

Have a nice day!

 

Best
column27:
Stella 

^Master of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^JUNTAO xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: career questions about MSiA^Dear Tien:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics program began with the 2012-2013 academic year; our first cohort is currently in their final stages and has not yet graduated. We are unable to provide the specific information you have requested. We will be looking to update the website with our students job placement information shortly. This field is expanding exponentially and there are fantastic job opportunities available to graduates of the Master of Science in Analytics program. Future job opportunities include: Lead analyst for a Fortune 500 firm
column2: Statistical Modeling Analysts
column3: Digital Strategy Analysts
column5: Systems Engineers
column6: Consultants
column7:
or Entrepreneur.

 

Please check our website in the upcoming month after graduation for our statistics on job placements and companies our students received offers from.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column8: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: so industry experience
column12: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column13:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column18:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column22:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 22% Information Technology
column25: 6% Academia
column26: 6% Finance
column27:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column28: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column29: and the deadline will be in February 15
column30:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1: RE: Application Help^Hi Jeremy
column2: I apologize for this. I can enter the system and remove the receipt of your GMAT score. To clarify the situation
column3: the only individuals who have access to the application managing system are myself and a temporary hire. We had been uploading and updating student profiles in the system and she must have found your score report and attached it to your online record. However
column4:
I built your application packet and did not include your GMAT report so the admissions review committee will not see your scores. 

 

I will remove the record today and you should see the change reflected within 24hours.

 

Regards

column1:
RE: MS in Analytics Deadline Approaching^Dear Shashi;

 

We use a third party to collect our application fees. We receive reports infrequently (hence a delay time in the time stamp) we are unable to change the time stamp we mark on a students application page
column2: but it will have no effect on your application. The time stamp is just to mark when weve received the report
column3:
but the original documents do show you paid before our deadline of 11:59pm CST. 

 

I apologize for the misinformation on our side with the time stamp but the two systems do not link to eachother and are manually set but non adjustable. 

 

Please let me know if you require further assistance.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: Admission query^Dear Tanvi:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question concerning the TOEFL requirement
column2:
can you please provide a link or proof of the primary language of your school? I will mark it on your application notes for our reviewers to see if you fulfill this requirement and the TOEFL requirement will be waived.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27

RE: Admission query^Dear Tanvi:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question concerning the TOEFL requirement
column2:
can you please provide a link or proof of the primary language of your school? I will mark it on your application notes for our reviewers to see if you fulfill this requirement and the TOEFL requirement will be waived.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants

column1:
RE: Inquiry on Personal Statement^Dear May:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2: we are looking for your statement to be 500 words. We are requesting that you are sure to include the following topics in your statement
column3:
giving each the appropriate amount of attention.

*	Why are you applying to the Master of Science in Analytics at Northwestern University? Please include in your answer why you are interested in analytics as well as your career goals.
*	What skills or abilities do you hope to strengthen in the program? (one paragraph)
*	Describe a trend that will influence analytics over the next 5 years? (one paragraph) 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

column1:
RE: career questions about MSiA^Dear Tien:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics program began with the 2012-2013 academic year; our first cohort is currently in their final stages and has not yet graduated. We are unable to provide the specific information you have requested. We will be looking to update the website with our students job placement information shortly. This field is expanding exponentially and there are fantastic job opportunities available to graduates of the Master of Science in Analytics program. Future job opportunities include: Lead analyst for a Fortune 500 firm
column2: Statistical Modeling Analysts
column3: Digital Strategy Analysts
column5: Systems Engineers
column6: Consultants
column7:
or Entrepreneur.

 

Please check our website in the upcoming month after graduation for our statistics on job placements and companies our students received offers from.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column8: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: so industry experience
column12: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column13:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column18:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column22:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 22% Information Technology
column25: 6% Academia
column26: 6% Finance
column27:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column28: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column29: and the deadline will be in February 15
column30:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column31:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column32:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd
column33: E278\r\n\r\nEvanston

column1: RE: Master of Science in Analytics deadline inquiry^Hello Liu:\r\n\r\nI apologize for my delayed response time. We do look for our students to have some background in computer science. It seems as though you have knowledge of CS and I would be sure to mention it either on your resume or in your personal statement. The other way to have CS appear on your transcript is by taking classes such as CORESERA and including certificates from their programs in your resume. I believe you have an understanding of CS and that will help you application. We also run a 2 week boot camp at the university
column2: where our students are trained how to use SAS
column3: SQL
column5: Cognos
column6:
Tableau etc. 

Please let me know what other questions you may have about our admissions process.

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: Application^Dear Lan:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). Since they are not required we do not give out minimums or averages.  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column25:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: Prospective Student xxx@xxx.xxx sincerely
column26:
Lan Ma

^Master of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Prospective xxx@xxx.xxx

column1: RE: Questions about MS in Analytics^Dear Michael;\r\n\r\nThank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your questions
column2: the MSiA program is full-time for 15 months (including a required summer industry-focused internship). There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column3: however
column4:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/ <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/> 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column5: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience
column7: strong test scores
column9: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column10:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column15:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column19:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column25: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column26: and the deadline will be in February 15
column27:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column28:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column29:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: Masters in Analytics Information Requested^Dear Murtza: 

 

I am glad to hear you are interested in applying. 

 

To answer your question
column2: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction
column3: so
column4: you would not be required to submit scores. We accept scanned transcripts for the application process
column5: and should you be accepted
column6:
it would be an acceptance contingent on receiving original transcripts from each of your degree-granting institutions. 

 

And to answer your question concerning the letters of recommendation
column7:
we are happy to accept hard copies.

Supplementary materials may be mailed to:

Master of Science in Analytics

Department of Industrial Engineering and Management Sciences

2145 Sheridan Road
column9:
IL 60208

 

 

I look forward to seeing your application.  Please let me know if you have any additional questions. 

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant
column10:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: Masters in Analytics Information Requested^Dear Murtza: 

 

I am glad to hear you are interested in applying. 

 

To answer your question
column2: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction
column3: so
column4: you would not be required to submit scores. We accept scanned transcripts for the application process
column5: and should you be accepted
column6:
it would be an acceptance contingent on receiving original transcripts from each of your degree-granting institutions. 

 

And to answer your question concerning the letters of recommendation
column7:
we are happy to accept hard copies.

Supplementary materials may be mailed to:

Master of Science in Analytics

Department of Industrial Engineering and Management Sciences

2145 Sheridan Road
column9:
IL 60208

 

 

I look forward to seeing your application.  Please let me know if you have any additional questions. 

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant
column10:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: Prospective Applicant^Hello Bella:

 

We accept 32 students a year. While this will undoubtedly mean that admission will be highly selective
column2:
it will also mean we can give appropriate attention to those who are admitted. We are aiming to foster a collaborative atmosphere within the program and believe that a small cohort of exceptionally talented and strongly motivated students will best enable us to achieve this. 

 

While we have many students enrolled in our program form CS and EE backgrounds we do not limit our admissions process to those academic majors. We look to build a collaborative cohort each year with a variety of backgrounds and interests. We have not had students in our program with a similar background to yours and I would be sure to mention that in your personal statement. As an academic institution we are very interested in applying analytics in a wide variety of fields of interest. I would not look at your background as weaker or negative
column3:
but unique. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column5: Gender mix: Male 69%
column6: Female 31%
column7: Nationality: US 62.5%
column8:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column9: 28% Economics and Social Sciences
column12:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column17:
4% Engineering

 

Please let me know what other questions and concerns you have about applying to our program.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant
column18:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd
column20:
IL 60208

T: 847.467.4520

F: 847.491.8005

 

www.analytics.northwestern.edu <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/> 

 

 

 

 

From: xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx Thanks again!

 

Have a nice day!

 

Bella

 

From: Master of Science in Analytics xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: MSiA Program Inquiry^Dear Lin

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column25:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

-----Original Message-----
From: Lin Li xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: Application^Dear Lan:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). Since they are not required we do not give out minimums or averages.  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column25:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: Prospective Student xxx@xxx.xxx sincerely
column26:
Lan Ma

^Master of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Prospective xxx@xxx.xxx

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: Prospective Applicant^Hello Bella:

 

We accept 32 students a year. While this will undoubtedly mean that admission will be highly selective
column2:
it will also mean we can give appropriate attention to those who are admitted. We are aiming to foster a collaborative atmosphere within the program and believe that a small cohort of exceptionally talented and strongly motivated students will best enable us to achieve this. 

 

While we have many students enrolled in our program form CS and EE backgrounds we do not limit our admissions process to those academic majors. We look to build a collaborative cohort each year with a variety of backgrounds and interests. We have not had students in our program with a similar background to yours and I would be sure to mention that in your personal statement. As an academic institution we are very interested in applying analytics in a wide variety of fields of interest. I would not look at your background as weaker or negative
column3:
but unique. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column5: Gender mix: Male 69%
column6: Female 31%
column7: Nationality: US 62.5%
column8:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column9: 28% Economics and Social Sciences
column12:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column17:
4% Engineering

 

Please let me know what other questions and concerns you have about applying to our program.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

we have received your application fee. We use a third party to collect our application fees and there is a delay between the two systems. We do not update the student checklists until the Monday of each week. I have manually adjusted your account to show that you have paid. 

 

With regard to your GRE score
column3: we have not received it at our office as of today
column5:
when ETS sends out scores they bundle them in one large packet. Due to the recent bad weather here in the United States we have had a delay in our mail delivery. My advice is for you to email us a PDF from the ETS website which acknowledges your scores (if the best you can find is a screen shot) I will attach this to your file until your original score arrives. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column6:
we are looking forward to reviewing your application for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

RE: campus visit^Hi Scott;

 

Thank you for reaching out in regards to your application! I am very sorry to say that because of the high volume of application weve received this admissions season
column2: we are unable to accommodate on-campus visits between now and our admissions decisions. Should you still want to plan a visit to campus and an opportunity to sit in on several classes after March 17
column3: we would be happy to assist.\r\n\r\nIn the interim

We are looking forward to seeing your complete application. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

column1: RE: Recommendation Letters^Dear Yi;\r\n\r\nThank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2: unfortunately
column3: we have a very short turn around for applications. We pass off completed applications to our admissions committee the following week and there is not a lot of room in regards for late materials. \r\n\r\nIn regards to your Letters of Recommendation
column4: my advice is that you tell them it is a rushed letter and they can email the letter to this address when it is finished and I will attach it until your application is passed to the admissions committee. If this is not possible
column5:
I would suggest finding an alternative recommender.

Please let me know if you have additional questions to this information.

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

Victoria.

column1: RE: Clarification: Application for MS in business analytics at NorthWestern university^Dear Ram
column2:
Thank you for submitting your additional materials to the Master of Science in Analytics at Northwestern University. We have uploaded them into our MAP system and it should be reflected in your account within 24 hours. 

 

In response to your inquiry with your transcripts
column3: due to the high volume we are receiving we cannot guarantee a confirmation email. However
column4: you can track the status of your application in the MAP system (application system) check list which we will update as we receive your materials. I am a little concerned with timing however in relation to your transcript. Currently
column5:
due to nationwide bad weather we have had our post delayed. We do accept scanned copies of your transcript. I can upload that into our system on your behalf and we will replace them with your official copies upon their arrival. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions regarding the MS in Analytics program. We will announce our admission decisions on March 18th. 

 

We look forward to reviewing your application. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1: RE: MSiA Program^Dear Richard
column2: Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column3: unfortunately
column4:
we have a very short turn around for applications. We pass off completed applications to our admissions committee the following week and there is not a lot of room in regards for late materials. 

 

That being said
column5: we do have a few policies which will allow you to complete your application rather quickly. We do not request official transcripts while in the application process
column6: we only ask for official mailed and sealed transcripts after you have been accepted to the program. The same idea applies to any additional materials (GRE/TOEFL scores
column7: which are not required) we only ask for a PDF of your scores. In regards to your Letters of Recommendation
column8:
my advice is that you tell them it is a rushed letter and they can email the letter to this address when it is finished and I will attach it until your application is passed to the admissions committee. 

 

Please let me know if you have additional questions to this information.

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column9:
we are looking forward to reviewing your application for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: admissions^Dear Sumeet;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question concerning the GRE; neither the GRE nor the GMAT are required for admission to the Master of Science in Analytics but we will accept scores from applicants who choose to provide them to us. We believe we can draw enough information from the remainder of an application package to make an assessment of a candidate's suitability for the program. In some cases
column2: supplying a standardized test score may be recommended
column3: particularly in instances where a high score might be indicative of abilities not demonstrated elsewhere in the application. During admissions for the 2013-14 cohort
column4: approximately 75% of candidates provided scores. Unfortunately
column5: we cannot accept any additional materials after Feb 15th. We have a very small window of time for our reviewers to evaluate applicants before they are provided offer letters
column6: therefore we will be creating student applicant packets for completed applications directly after the 15th. Your application is complete without you sitting for the GMAT. \r\n\r\nIn regards to your question concerning your transcripts from India
column7: we do not require official transcripts until after you have been admitted to the program. Our admissions committee can evaluate scanned pdf copies of your transcript. Due to the approaching deadline
column8:
I would recommend you to email us at xxx@xxx.xxx xxx@xxx.xxx 

Follow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxx 

 

 

From: Sumeet Aneja xxx@xxx.xxx You must submit official
column9:
sealed transcripts mailed directly from the University to the MAP office

 

 

Thanks
column10: Sumeet\r\n\r\n^Master of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Sumeet xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: GRE Inquiry^Dear Glenn;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question concerning the GRE; neither the GRE nor the GMAT are required for admission to the Master of Science in Analytics but we will accept scores from applicants who choose to provide them to us. In your question
column2:
I believe you have reported your score results in the Academic Credentials we will not evaluate based on that information unless we are provided an official copy from ETS. 

Our GRE code is 3672.

This being said
column3: unfortunately
column4:
ETS takes a minimum of 10 business days to mail out scores. Due to the fast approaching deadline my recommendation to you is to provide us with a PDF from ETS acknowledging your score. This can be created from your ETS profile. Please send us some form of your score from the ETS site and it will stand in place of you score until we receive your official ETS score.

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column5:
we are looking forward to reviewing your application for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

column1:
RE: Information on employment^Dear Piyush;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2: we have just graduated our first cohort and have not yet released our industry statistics. We are awaiting some information from students before we publish on our site. However
column3: I can tell you that before our students graduated 93% already accepted jobs
column4: and after graduation 100% have received job offers. In regards to names of companies who have hired from MSiA
column5: we have a list of companies on our website
column6: page linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/index.html>
column7: who offered our students internships over the summer. 90% of these internships produced job offers to the students who were at the respective companies. A few students declined those positions
column8:
but that can provide you with an idea of which companies have recruited with us in the past year. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column9:
we are looking forward to reviewing your application for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column10:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: Information on employment^Dear Piyush;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2: we have just graduated our first cohort and have not yet released our industry statistics. We are awaiting some information from students before we publish on our site. However
column3: I can tell you that before our students graduated 93% already accepted jobs
column4: and after graduation 100% have received job offers. In regards to names of companies who have hired from MSiA
column5: we have a list of companies on our website
column6: page linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/index.html>
column7: who offered our students internships over the summer. 90% of these internships produced job offers to the students who were at the respective companies. A few students declined those positions
column8:
but that can provide you with an idea of which companies have recruited with us in the past year. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column9:
we are looking forward to reviewing your application for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column10:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: Clarification: Application for MS in business analytics at NorthWestern university^Dear Ramkumar;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2: we request you submit your official TOEFL and GMAT scores. That being said ETS will take a minimum of 10 business days. My advice for your application to be complete before the Feb 15th deadline is as follows. The GMAT will allow you to download a PDF of your score
column3: please email that PDF to this email account and I will attach it to your file. Please provide us with a PDF ecopy of your TOEFL in the same manner
column4: if you cannot download a score
column5:
please just show us ETS acknowledgment of your score.

 

Meanwhile please send your TOEFL score to us via ETS code 3144
column6:
and GMAT code 6W2TL36. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column7:
we are looking forward to reviewing your application for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1: RE: Years of study^Hello Pradeep;\r\n\r\nI apologize for the delay in response time from our department. We are glad that there is an interest in our program
column2: analytics is a growing field and our goal is to identify and assess the opportunities
column3: needs and constraints for data usage within an organizational context; integrate information technology and data science to maximize the value of data; design innovative and creative data analytics solutions; communicate clearly and persuasively to a variety of audiences; lead analytics teams and projects.\r\n\r\nTo answer your question concerning years of study and prerequisites
column4: we look for graduation from an accredited university with a bachelors degree. Traditionally
column5: we have accepted students from 4-year undergraduate programs
column6: but that is not a requirement for our course. We require a minimum of a 3.0 GPA
column7: 3 letters of recommendation
column8: and a TOEFL/IELTS test. The GRE is recommended for students who feel that their quantitative abilities are not conveyed in their application
column9: and when it strengthens a candidate. \r\n\r\nWe do not require applicants to have background knowledge with all of the industry tools we use
column13: SQL Tableau etc. We offer a two week boot camp before the fall quarter. We have industry representatives come to campus and train our students with these tools so they are prepared for their course work. We look for candidates with strong quantitative backgrounds
column16: and algebra.\r\n\r\nAgain I apologize for the delay in responding to you
column17: please let me know what further questions you have and I will answer them to the best of my abilities. We do offer an information session where your friends daughter can listen to our Associate Program director break down admissions and our program
column18: which will then open up to a Q&A. The next information session is Nov. 15th at noon CST. For more information please look here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/information-sessions.html> . \r\n\r\nIf you have more questions too

column1:
RE: Enquiry^Dear Johan:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions:

1.       We had 400 students apply and we only take 32 candidates for the Fall 

2.       Since we do not require students to submit a GRE score we do not average their scores or release them. 

3.       We have 37.5% of our students are International.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Please see Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column25:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: Johan Alex Varghese xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1: RE: Inquiries on IELTS requirement^Dear Erica
column2: Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column3: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction
column5:
you would not be required to submit scores. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column6:
we are looking forward to reviewing your application for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

column2: Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column3: we have received your additional materials and your application payment. After you submit an application our system sends out an auto-generated email to remind applicants of the additional requirements for applying to Northwestern. I apologize for the confusion
column4:
but you do not need to submit your materials twice. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to reviewing your application for Fall 2014!

column2: there is some flexibility in the courses students take
column3: but we are not focused on Management in our course
column4: if this is something you are interested in I encourage you to look at our Master of Engineering Management
column5:
linked here. <http://mem.northwestern.edu/> 

 

To answer your question concerning references
column6: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column7: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column8:

column1:
RE: Enquiry - M.S. in Analytics^Dear Krushnan

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

To answer your question
column8: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction. We accept scanned transcripts for the application process
column9: and should you be accepted
column10: it would be an acceptance contingent on receiving original transcripts from each of your degree-granting institutions. Test scores must be less than two years old at the date of matriculation (for the 2014-15 cohort
column12: 2014). The minimum acceptable score for the TOEFL is 85 (Internet based test) and for the IELTS
column13:
7.0. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column18:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column22:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 22% Information Technology
column25: 6% Academia
column26: 6% Finance
column27:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column28: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column29: and the deadline will be in February 15
column30:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column31:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1: RE: MSiA Prospective student question^Dear Shiva;\r\n\r\nThank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I would love to answer your questions
column2:
I apologize for the delay in our response time. 

 

Please see below for answers to your questions; 

1.       With regards to anything related to visas we suggest students to research the Northwestern University Internationals Offices website. They have an entire staff focused on all of the laws and rules associated with visas. We prefer not to provide any advice or information in this regard in case we do not give you correct information. Their website is linked here.

2.       Each student will complete 3 industry provided projects while they attend our program. Our Practicum project and Capstone project are not paid projects for the students. These are used to learn and develop your skills to make you successful in the workplace. They are paired with your classes and you will learn and develop skills to accompany these projects. However
column3: you are able to negotiate your payment for the internship in the summer quarter. We allow students to choose any internship they would like in any industry (as long as it fulfills an analytics requirement) and they negotiate their summer salary.\r\n\r\n3.       In regards to selection of projects
column4:
our director selects 8 companies and company supplied projects for the practicum assignment. Students then apply to us with the projects they would like to work on and we then assign students to one of the projects. Projects cross all industry and fields. 

 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program. We are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014.

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

RE: Regarding transcripts mailing method^Dear Mengchun;

 

I apologize for our delayed response time. Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

 

Please submit an electronic copy of transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended whether you have received a degree or not. This includes degrees currently in progress and study abroad credit.

For ease of processing
column2: please label your files in the following format
column3:
FirstName-LastName-InstitutionName

eg: Sally-Smith-UniversityofSydney

All pages of the transcript should be scanned. Please ensure they are legible. If your transcripts are not in English
column4: please send a copy in the original language and a certified translation. \r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 16

column2: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column3: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column4:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

Professional

0

3

0

1-3

2

1

3-5

1

2

5+

0

3

column1:
RE: question about application^Dear Shannon;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. Test scores must be less than two years old at the date of matriculation (for the 2014-15 cohort
column2: this will be September 23
column3: 2014). The minimum acceptable score for the TOEFL is 85 (Internet based test) and for the IELTS
column4: 7.0. Our TOEFL code is 3144. In regards to your work experience
column5:
we have students who come from 1year to 18years of work experience in our program (I have included a class breakdown in this email).

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column6: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column7: so industry experience
column9: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column10: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column11:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column16:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Finance
column25:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column26: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column27: and the deadline will be in February 15
column28:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column29:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column30:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd
column31: E278\r\n\r\nEvanston
column32:
IL 60208

T: 847.467.4520

F: 847.491.8005

From: Shannon Hu xxx@xxx.xxx 

 

Regards

column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  We do not have an official cut off for the GRE
column3: our only advice is if you think your score is high enough to quantify and display your quantitative knowledge I encourage you to submit it. The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8: but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. In regards to our TOEFL requirement
column9:
we ask for you score above an 85. 

 

To answer your question concerning references
column10: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column11: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column12:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

Professional

0

3

0

1-3

2

1

3-5

1

2

5+

0

3

 

 

In regards to your question of a statement of financial support
column13: we do not require it for our application process. For more information on application materials and our application process I encourage you to look at our webpage
column14:
linked here <http://analytics-dev.tech.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/materials.html> .

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column16: and the deadline will be in February 15
column17:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column18:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column19:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: Prospective Student^Dear Michael;

 

I apologize for our delayed response time
column2:
due to the number of emails we have received we have been late to answer student inquiries. 

 

Our classes will coincide with the Northwestern Academic calendar for 2014. Classes will begin September 23rd. We host a 2week bootcamp the weeks preceding class start time
column3:
so we will ask for students to be on campus the week of the 8th. 

 

In regards to information sessions or visiting campus
column4: we are unable to accommodate on campus visits at this time due to application season. If you would like to see Northwestern
column5:
the Admissions office can set up a campus tour. Lindsay Montanari (our associate director) is available for 10-15min phone calls to answer any lingering questions you have about the program. Please let me know if this would be beneficial and I will set up a phone call with Lindsay.

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: Application^Dear Lan:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). Since they are not required we do not give out minimums or averages.  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column25:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: Prospective Student xxx@xxx.xxx sincerely
column26:
Lan Ma

^Master of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Prospective xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: MSiA program^Dear Gayatri;

 

Thank you for reaching out to me with your concerns regarding the MS in Analytics Program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2:
we have not finalized the salary information for our first cohort yet. We will be advertising our job placement information in the coming weeks on our website. I know this is unhelpful for you as a current applicant for the next year. We do have a list of internships our students took over the summer and many students chose to take full time positions within those companies. I encourage you to look at that list for an example of the types of companies our students work at. 

 

Please let me know any remaining questions your may have in regards to the MS in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond
