column1:
RE: Application^Dear Lan:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). Since they are not required we do not give out minimums or averages.  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column25:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: Prospective Student xxx@xxx.xxx sincerely
column26:
Lan Ma

^Master of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Prospective xxx@xxx.xxx

column1: RE: MSiA Application_ Additional Material (Transcripts
column2: GMAT
column3: TOEFL) - Nitika Lal^Dear Nitika;\r\n\r\nThank you for submitting your transcripts and additional materials to the Master of Science in Analytics at Northwestern University. We have uploaded them into our MAP system and it should be reflected in your account within 24 hours. The scanned version of your transcript is the only requirement for your application
column4:
we will ask for an official transcript if you are accepted into the program. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions regarding the MS in Analytics program. We will announce our admission decisions on March 18th. 

 

I apologize for not responding to your inquiry earlier. We have had a high volume of emails due to the upcoming deadline for applications and have been slow to respond to student inquiry. You will not need to send an official transcript until you have been accepted into the program. In regards to your TOEFL and GMAT scan; we have not yet received your scores but will include them in your application when they arrive. Please note that we have marked your additional materials as received in your Student Checklist.

 

We look forward to reviewing your application. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Thank you for submitting your transcripts to the Master of Science in Analytics at Northwestern University. We have uploaded them into our MAP system and it should be reflected in your account within 24 hours. The scanned version of your transcript is the only requirement for your application
column2:
we will ask for an official transcript if you are accepted into the program. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions regarding the MS in Analytics program. We will announce our admission decisions on March 18th. 

 

We look forward to reviewing your application. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1: RE: International Candidate - MS Analytics program 2014^Dear Sahil;\r\n\r\nThank you for submitting your transcript and additional materials to the Master of Science in Analytics at Northwestern University. We have uploaded them into our MAP system and it should be reflected in your account within 24 hours. The scanned version of your transcript is the only requirement for your application
column2:
we will ask for an official transcript if you are accepted into the program. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions regarding the MS in Analytics program. We will announce our admission decisions on March 18th. 

 

1.       We require your official TOEFL score to be reported by ETS. If you could send it our code is 3144.

2.       We offer a limited number of merit based fellowships. For more information about our tuition costs and financial aid I encourage you to look at our webpage
column3: linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> . We do not require any additional application materials for our fellowships
column4:
the admissions review committee will select the candidates based on merit and offer the fellowships to the top qualifying candidates. There is more financial aid links located on our website for you to explore additional funding options at the university.



We look forward to reviewing your application. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: 2041 Fall Master of Science in Analytics Program^Dear Wenxiao;

 

Thank you for reaching out to me at the MS in Analytics department at Northwestern University. I have gone into our application manager system and checked your application. Currently
column2: it does say that you have paid. We use a third party to collect all of our fees at Northwestern University
column3:
therefore the student checklist only gets updated once a week with the payments. 

 

Unfortunately
column5: I cannot see your letters of recommendation. I am unclear of how they would be removed if your recommenders submitted them. My suggestion is that you email them and request them to forward their letter of reference to this email address xxx@xxx.xxx xxx@xxx.xxx \r\n\r\nFollow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1: RE: Question about interview^Good Morning Skuntala;\r\n\r\nI hope you are having a wonderful day. We do not have a mandatory interview related with application reviews. Our admissions committee will be in contact with you if they require a skype interview
column2: regarding any lingering questions. But we do not have a policy for interviews currently. However
column3: we will not ask for students to come on campus for interviews
column4:
all interviews conducted will be via skype. 

Please let me know if you have any remaining questions.

column1: RE: Official transcript and TOEFL score (Applicant: Yue Wang)^Dear Yue;\r\n\r\nThank you for submitting your transcript and TOEFL score to the Master of Science in Analytics at Northwestern University. We have uploaded them into our MAP system and it should be reflected in your account within 24 hours. The scanned version of your transcript is the only requirement for your application
column2:
we will ask for an official transcript if you are accepted into the program. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions regarding the MS in Analytics program. We will announce our admission decisions on March 18th. 

 

In regards to your GRE score report
column3:
if you would like us to consider your scores please send us a PDF copy. We will also accept an official score via ETS. Our code is 3672.

 

We look forward to reviewing your application. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: Questions for applying master in analytics program^Dear Wangyang:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

1.  To answer your question
column2: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction
column3: so
column4: you would not be required to submit scores. We accept scanned transcripts for the application process
column5: and should you be accepted
column6: it would be an acceptance contingent on receiving original transcripts from each of your degree-granting institutions.\r\n2.  Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column7: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. We do not have a code currently for the GRE. We ask for you to submit a scanned copy to this email address which we keep for our records. Since it is not a requirement  and there is no formal cutoff score for the GRE we do not release or track student information. Only submit your GRE score if you believe it will fill a hole in your transcript and prove your quantitative prowess. 

 The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15
column25: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond
Program Assistant
column27:
Master of Science in Analytics

Northwestern University
Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science
2145 Sheridan Rd
column28: E278\r\nEvanston
column29:
IL 60208
T: 847.467.4520
F: 847.491.8005

www.analytics.northwestern.edu



-----Original Message-----
From: Wangyang Wu xxx@xxx.xxx Whats the institution code and program code for requesting ETS to send GRE for you? And could your provide me the average statistic of GRE from current students in your program?


Thanks!
regards!

Wangyang Wu
School of Information Sciences
University of Pittsburgh

column1:
RE: Pre-requisites for the Masters of Science in Analytics.^Dear Amit:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7: but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. \r\n\r\nWhen we evaluate candidates we are typically looking for a background in quantitative classes (such as statistics
column8: linear algebra etc) and some Computer science background. We do not expect you to be an expert at programing
column9: and we encourage a diverse background in our students
column10: but we do look to see what experience applicants have with programming. We run a 2 week boot camp at the beginning of our academic calendar where we run a training on different programs we use
column14:
Tableau etc. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column19: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column23: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 28% Consulting and Professional Services
column25: 22% Information Technology
column26: 6% Academia
column27: 6% Finance
column28: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 16
column29: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column30: and the deadline will be in February 15
column31: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column32:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!


Victoria L. Richmond
Program Assistant
column33:
Master of Science in Analytics

Northwestern University
Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science
2145 Sheridan Rd
column35:
IL 60208

column2: please email us a scanned copy. I will upload this in at least 3-10 business days and it will be reflected in your application checklist. Our admissions review committee only requires a scanned version of your transcript. However
column3:

In regards to your GRE score; as of January 24th we did not have an official code with the GRE. If you submitted your GRE score to Northwestern University it would be given to the central university admissions and we will not receive it in our office
column4: there is nothing to distinguish which program you are applying to using Northwesterns code. We have just opened a code with the GRE (I apologize for the delay) and it is 3672. If you would like to have the GRE send us a report please use this code to reference our specific program at Northwestern University. However
column5: this year due to the delay in the code
column6: we will accept a scanned pdf of your GRE to upload into our system. If you would like to include that in an email I will update your account. Emailing us a scanned version

column1: RE: Question about TOEFL^Dear Zhihao;\r\n\r\nThank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction
column3: so
column4: you would not be required to submit scores. We accept scanned transcripts for the application process
column5: and should you be accepted
column6:
it would be an acceptance contingent on receiving original transcripts from each of your degree-granting institutions. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column7: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: strong test scores
column11: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column12:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column17:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column21:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Academia
column25: 6% Finance
column26:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column27: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column28: and the deadline will be in February 15
column29:
2014. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column30:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: GRE and Recommendations^Dear Ryan;

 

I apologize for the delay in our response to your question. We had hopes of receiving a GRE code sooner
column2:
but were delayed in the process.

 

To answer your question concerning the GRE; neither the GRE nor the GMAT are required for admission to the Master of Science in Analytics but we will accept scores from applicants who choose to provide them to us. We believe we can draw enough information from the remainder of an application package to make an assessment of a candidate's suitability for the program. In some cases
column3: supplying a standardized test score may be recommended
column4: particularly in instances where a high score might be indicative of abilities not demonstrated elsewhere in the application. During admissions for the 2013-14 cohort
column5:
approximately 75% of candidates provided scores. 

Our GRE code is 3672.

To answer your question concerning references
column6: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column7: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column8:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

Professional

0

3

0

1-3

2

1

3-5

1

2

5+

0

3

 




 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions regarding the MS in Analytics program. 

 

We look forward to reviewing your application. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

We believe we can draw enough information from the remainder of an application package to make an assessment of a candidate's suitability for the program. In some cases
column4: supplying a standardized test score may be recommended
column5: particularly in instances where a high score might be indicative of abilities not demonstrated elsewhere in the application. During admissions for the 2013-14 cohort
column6:
approximately 75% of candidates provided scores. 

Our GRE code is 3672.

Please let me know if you have any additional questions regarding the MS in Analytics program. 

 

We look forward to reviewing your application. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

column1: RE: Require details of the course^Dear Raj;\r\n\r\nThank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2: we ask students to email us a scanned copy of their scores. If you can provide us with an email copy of your IELTS score I will attach it to your application. If you prefer to mail it the please send it to the address you have listed. I would like to point out our deadline is approaching quickly
column3: and we will not accept any additional materials after Feb 15th. The scanned version may be the fastest way to ensure we receive in time. \r\n\r\nBoth GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9: but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column10: we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!\r\nVictoria L. Richmond\r\nProgram Assistant 3
column11:
Master of Science in Analytics

Northwestern University
Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

column1: RE: Require details of the course^Dear Raj;\r\n\r\nThank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2: we ask students to email us a scanned copy of their scores. If you can provide us with an email copy of your IELTS score I will attach it to your application. If you prefer to mail it the please send it to the address you have listed. I would like to point out our deadline is approaching quickly
column3: and we will not accept any additional materials after Feb 15th. The scanned version may be the fastest way to ensure we receive in time. \r\n\r\nBoth GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9: but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column10: we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!\r\nVictoria L. Richmond\r\nProgram Assistant 3

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: Inquiries of Master of Science in Analytics^Dear Erica;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions please see below:

1.       We will waive your TOEFL/IELTS requirement
column2: please provide me with a link to your schools website where they state that English is the language of instruction. \r\n\r\n2.       We do not have any pre-requisites for our course
column3: we look for applicants who have a background in quantitative courses (statistics
column5: linear algebra etc) and some IT/programming background.\r\n\r\n3.       To answer your question regarding financial support
column6: the Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column7: no additional applications will need to be submitted for consideration. For more information in regards to financial aid and funding
column8: I encourage you to explore those possibilities on our website
column9: linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> .\r\n\r\n4.       In regards to your GRE score
column10:
please email us your unofficial scores and I will attach that to your file. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column11: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column15: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column16:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column21:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column24: 13% Business and Management Sciences
column25:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column26: 28% Consulting and Professional Services
column27: 22% Information Technology
column28: 6% Academia
column29: 6% Finance
column30:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column31: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column32: and the deadline will be in February 15
column33:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column34:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column35:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column2:
I encourage you to scan us a PDF of your resume. I will upload it into our MAP system on your behalf and send you a confirmation after it has been loaded. At that point you can check your checklist for any other additional materials that may need to be submitted.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column9:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: GPA requirements^Dear Govind;

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions please see below:

1.       We only require official transcripts after you have been admitted into the program. We ask for a scanned copy of your transcript. As we get closer to the deadline (Feb 15th) it would be faster for you to scan and email this account with your unofficial transcript. 

2.       In regards to your GMAT score
column2:
we ask for you to email your copy of the GMAT scores. We do not have a specific code for the MS in Analytics program within Northwestern. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column3:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column4:
Master of Science in Analytics

column1: RE: Recommendation^Hello Jeff
column2:
If you could give your recommender the following instructions and have them email me a pdf of your letter I will manually update our system. I am sorry this took so long. We are in the process of transitioning systems and getting into our auto generated emails has been difficult. 

 

Jeff Shen  is an applicant for the Master of Science in Analytics Program (MSiA) at Northwestern University McCormick School of Engineering. More information about the MSiA program may be found at our website <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu> .

Applicants to the MSiA program are required to submit three letters of recommendation in support of their application

column1:
RE: MS Business analytics^Dear Divyaa;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions please see below:

1.       We enroll 32 students for each Fall cohort. For information on our current student profiles I encourage you to look at our student page on our website
column2: linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/index.html> .\r\n\r\n2.       In regards to tuition
column3: the 2013-2014 academic year costs $15
column4: 038 per quarter. You are on campus for 4 quarters in our 15month program (1 quarter you will be in industry for an internship and will not be charged). For a full breakdown of our tuition and fees from this academic year
column5: please look at our prospective students page on our website
column6:
linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> . We also provide information for Fellowship opportunities and various links to scholarships within Northwestern.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column7: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: strong test scores
column11: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column12:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column17:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column21:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Academia
column25: 6% Finance
column26:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column27: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column28: and the deadline will be in February 15
column29:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column30:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Master of Science in Analytics

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

RE: Application Fee payment - Ramakrishnan Subramonian^Dear Ramakrishnan;

 

Thank you for reaching out to our office with your concerns. I apologize for any delay on our end
column2:
our office has received a large number of application materials and we are currently at a 3-7 business day wait period to upload or address issues with applications. Monday (Jan 20th) Northwestern University was closed to observe Martin Luther King day.

 

In regards to our application payment system
column3:
we use a third party to collect all fees and manually update the MAP system. As of today (1/21) your application reflects your payment being received by Northwestern University. 

 

We have received your GMAT and TOEFL scores and those have been added to your student account. You should see the change within 24hours reflected on your end.

We look forward to reviewing your application.

column1:
RE: MS in Business Analytics : Fall 2014^Dear S Nayak:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

 

Please see below for answers to your questions:

1.       We are a masters program housed under the Industrial Engineering and Management Studies department. Because we are we do qualify as a STEM program. 

2.       Tuition Fees <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> : For the 2013-2014 it will be $15
column2: 038/qtr. Your tuition will be due for the fall
column3: winter
column4: and spring quarters but not in the summer. \r\n\r\n3.       We offer a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column5: no additional application will need to be submitted for consideration. Please visit the Tuition and Fees page on our website for more opportunities of financial support within the Northwestern School system. We only control the Fellowships offered by our program. \r\n\r\n4.       We encourage you to submit a GRE score if you believe it will help prove your quantitative knowledge to our admissions committee. If you feel your academic transcript does not show your quantitative background then I would suggest submitting the GRE. 75% of our accepted students had submitted their scores. This is not a requirement for consideration for our program
column6: nor for our Fellowship.\r\n\r\n5.       Estimated Cost of Living: We tell students to budget around $22
column7: 000 for living expenses. There is a full breakdown of our costs on the Tuition page of our website. \r\n\r\n6.       In terms of Financial documents
column8: we do not require those. That is outside of our office
column9:
if you have questions I would suggest reaching out to the International Office to discuss obtaining an I20

7.       Currently we are graduating our inaugural cohort. We do not yet have any job placement statistics to provide. Once our students have graduated we will be updating our website with that information. Please check back with us at the end of December. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column14:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column18:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column23:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column25: and the deadline will be in February 15
column26:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

RE: Northwestern University Master of Science in Analytics Program^Dear Mouli;

 

Please see the following for answers to your questions concerning your application with the MSiA program. I apologize for any delay in our response time
column2:
we have a University holiday for Martin Luther King Jr Day and our office was not open yesterday. 

 

1.       We received payment for your application fee
column3:
we use a third party collection for application fees and therefore there is not an automatic reflection on your student MAP account.

2.       We have your transcripts and you are not required to send official copies until you are admitted to Northwestern University. 

3.       You additional materials are all uploaded into our system and you are not required to send us official copies. We can verify with ETS after you are admitted into our program. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions regarding your application status. Currently
column4:
you are regarded as having a complete application.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column3:

column1: RE: Master of Science in Analytics questions^Hello Manjola
column2: I apologize it has taken so long for our department to respond to your request. We are very eager for you to see our campus and our program. Your request was unique
column3:
in that we do not usually allow students to sit in on classes. I know you are eager to come in this week but due to the current academic calendar it would not be the best time. Students are in midterms and they will be testing all week. 

 

We want to offer you one of the following two options:

1.       In January we have a guest speaker coming for a seminar lecture
column4: we would love to have you come and visit
column5: sit in on our seminar series and a class
column6: as well as a meeting with our associate director. \r\n\r\n2.       If you want to visit in the fall
column7:
you can take a campus tour and have a 15min meeting with our Associate Director. 

Please let me know which option works best for your calendar. Again I apologize for the tardiness in response from our office. 

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1: RE: Northwestern University: Master of Science in Analytics Program - Applications are now being accepted for the 2014-2015 cohort^Dear Santosh;\r\n\r\nThank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I have included the directions from our website in regards to submitting your additional application materials
column2: if you would like more detail I encourage you to look at our prospective students page
column3: linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/materials.html> . \r\n\r\nGRE and GMAT (not compulsory
column4: submission details below)\r\n\r\nNeither the GRE nor the GMAT are required for admission to the Master of Science in Analytics but we will accept scores from applicants who choose to provide them to us. We believe we can draw enough information from the remainder of an application package to make an assessment of a candidate's suitability for the program. In some cases
column5: supplying a standardized test score may be recommended
column6: particularly in instances where a high score might be indicative of abilities not demonstrated elsewhere in the application. During admissions for the 2013-14 cohort
column7: approximately 75% of candidates provided scores. \r\n\r\nInstitution codes for the GRE and GMAT will be forthcoming. Until posted otherwise
column8:
please email scanned copies of the report to xxx@xxx.xxx xxx@xxx.xxx 

Follow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxx xxx@xxx.xxx 

On Fri
column9: Dec 6

column1:
RE: Question about program application^Dear Roy;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.  To answer your question concerning references
column2: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column3: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column4:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

Professional

0

3

0

1-3

2

1

3-5

1

2

5+

0

3

 

It is left to your discretion who writes your letters of reference. We will accept mailed letters as long as they reach our office by the deadline of February 15th. It would be quickest for your recommender to email us an electronic version
column5: however
column6:
we do understand there is a preference for a mailed letter of reference. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column7:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column8:
Master of Science in Analytics

column1:
RE: Question about program application^Dear Roy;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.  To answer your question concerning references
column2: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column3: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column4:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

Professional

0

3

0

1-3

2

1

3-5

1

2

5+

0

3

 

It is left to your discretion who writes your letters of reference. We will accept mailed letters as long as they reach our office by the deadline of February 15th. It would be quickest for your recommender to email us an electronic version
column5: however
column6:
we do understand there is a preference for a mailed letter of reference. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column7:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column8:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd
column9: E278\r\n\r\nEvanston

column1:
RE: Request for Information - M.S. in Data Science^Dear Naman;

 

I apologize for the delay in my response time to your inquiry. To answer your question
column2: we are unable to accept students at any time outside of a fall start. Due to the nature of our program our students work as a cohort. They enter the year together and begin a 9month practicum project which ties into course work throughout their first 3 quarters. There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column3: however
column4:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/ <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/> 

 

Please let me know if you have any remaining questions.

 

Happy New Years and Good Luck in 2014.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column5:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd
column6: E278\r\n\r\nEvanston
column7:
IL 60208

T: 847.467.4520

F: 847.491.8005

 

Follow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxx 

 

 

 

 

From: Naman Jain xxx@xxx.xxx 

Regards

RE: Request for Information - M.S. in Data Science^Dear Naman;

 

I apologize for the delay in my response time to your inquiry. To answer your question
column2: we are unable to accept students at any time outside of a fall start. Due to the nature of our program our students work as a cohort. They enter the year together and begin a 9month practicum project which ties into course work throughout their first 3 quarters. There are no online courses or part-time options available for this particular intensive program. Northwestern does
column3: however
column4:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies that can be done on-line while working. You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/ <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/> 

 

Please let me know if you have any remaining questions.

 

Happy New Years and Good Luck in 2014.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1: RE: Master of Science in Analytics deadline inquiry^Dear Liu\r\n\r\nTo answer your question concerning references
column2: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column3: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column4:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate	Academic	Professional
0					3			0
1-3					2			1
3-5					1			2
5+					0			3

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column5: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column6: and the deadline will be in February 15
column7: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column8:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: Prerequisites for the program Master of Science in Analytics^Dear Anshul:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7: but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. We look for applicants to have experience with calculus
column9:
and some programming languages.

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column14:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column18:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column23:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column25: and the deadline will be in February 15
column26:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column27:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column1:
RE: Admission query for MS in analytics^Dear Tarun:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). If you fear your GMAT score will affect our decision of your candidacy
column3: you do not need to include it in your application. The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

In regards to your IELTS score
column9:
you may send us confirmation via email. You do not need to send us a hard copy. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column14:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column18:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column23:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column25: and the deadline will be in February 15
column26:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

column2: we only allow students to enroll in the fall each year. We enroll our students as a cohort due to class work and the nature of our program. Unfortunately
column3:
our applications open in the fall and will close again in February. I encourage you to explore our curriculum page on our website  for more information on our courses and program design. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column14:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column18:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column23:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column25: and the deadline will be in February 15
column26:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1:
RE: Question about Recommendation^Dear Chun;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2:
we only provide that list as a guideline to help students who are applying to know what we are looking for in an application. If you chose to have 3 professional recommenders that is not a problem. We only suggest to have 1 academic reference so that we can have an idea of your ability as an academic. We do not have a problem if you would like to keep your 3 recommenders.

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

column1:
RE: Question about Recommendation^Dear Chun;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2:
we only provide that list as a guideline to help students who are applying to know what we are looking for in an application. If you chose to have 3 professional recommenders that is not a problem. We only suggest to have 1 academic reference so that we can have an idea of your ability as an academic. We do not have a problem if you would like to keep your 3 recommenders.

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column3: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column4: and the deadline will be in February 15
column5:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column6:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

column2: please see the following:\r\n\r\n1.       The following is the background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column3: 28% Economics and Social Sciences
column5: 13% Business and Management Sciences
column6: 3% Natural Sciences. We do look for our applicants to have a foundation in calculus and statistics.\r\n\r\n2.       Since our applicants are not required to give us a GRE/GMAT score we do not release averages. However
column7: if you believe that your score will help prove your quantitative background in a way your transcript cannot
column8: I encourage your to include your score in your application.\r\n\r\n3.       Our students have a wide variety of interests and we support their various fields of analytics. We have students looking into finance
column9: health care
column12: and social media. For a list of internships our students found please look at our Current Students webpage
column13:
linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/index.html> . We will be listing job placement information shortly. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column14: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column18: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column19:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column24:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column25: 28% Consulting and Professional Services
column26: 22% Information Technology
column27: 6% Academia
column28: 6% Finance
column29:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

column2:
please see the following:

1.       We have just graduated our first cohort this winter. We will be releasing salary information and job placement shortly. I apologize for the inability to address your question.

2.       We use both the University Career Services
column3: and our own contacts to help our students find internships for the summer. We work one on one with our students to ensure they have an internship in the field they are interested in. Since
column4: internships are a required aspect in our course we make sure all of our students have a summer internship. You can find all of the internships our first class had on our current students page
column5: linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/index.html> .\r\n\r\n3.       According to McKenzie
column6: analytics is one of the fastest growing fields. There are more jobs than qualified candidates. We have had many companies reach out to us looking for our students to be a part of new analytics teams
column7:
or begin their own teams.

column1: RE: Master of Science in Analytics deadline inquiry^Dear Yu\r\n\r\nTo answer your question concerning references
column2: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column3: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column4:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate	Academic	Professional
0					3			0
1-3					2			1
3-5					1			2
5+					0			3

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column5: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column6: and the deadline will be in February 15
column7: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

column1: RE: Master of Science in Analytics deadline inquiry^Dear Yu\r\n\r\nTo answer your question concerning references
column2: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column3: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column4:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate	Academic	Professional
0					3			0
1-3					2			1
3-5					1			2
5+					0			3

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column5: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column6: and the deadline will be in February 15
column7: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

column4:
the university does offer graduate student housing. We leave student accommodations entirely up to the applicants. 

3.       We ask for a minimum of 7.0 for IELTS reports. Your 8.5 score is above our minimum. We accept scanned copies of your IELTS score.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column5: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience

column1:
RE: Question about official transcript^Dear Xiang:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I apologize for the delay in our response time. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question concerning your courses at a community college
column2: if the course scores transferred and are represented on your official university transcript
column3:
we do not require a separate transcript from your community college. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column5: and the deadline will be in February 15
column6:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session.

column1: RE: Master of Science in Analytics deadline inquiry^Dear Liu\r\n\r\nTo answer your question concerning references
column2: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column3: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column4:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate	Academic	Professional
0					3			0
1-3					2			1
3-5					1			2
5+					0			3

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column5: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column6: and the deadline will be in February 15
column7: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column8:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: Enquiries about TOEFL exam^Dear Christy:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I apologize for the delay in our response time to your inquiry. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Please provide us with an official website or notice from your university which states that you have been taught in English
column2:
upon receipt of that statement we will mark it in your application and your TOEFL score will be waived. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15
column25:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session.

RE: Queries regarding applications for Fall 2014^Dear Auroshis:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I apologize for the delay in our response time.  The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Please see below for answers to your questions. 

1.       We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column2: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column3:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

0

3

0

1-3

2

1

3-5

1

2

5+

0

3

2.       We will accept a scanned copy of an official letter from your college stating the medium of instruction as English
column4:
and I will mark it in your application as a waiver for your TOEFL score.

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program

etc. come to campus for full-day instruction and informational sessions. You are not required to have a mastery of these programs prior to entering the MSiA program.

column1:
RE: Hi I have a question regarding GMAT score.^Dear Eui Suk

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program

column2: the cost of $15
column3: 000 per quarter are for the four quarters you are taking classes at Northwestern
column4: therefore it does not include the period when you are in your summer internship. Our students typically find summer internships which are paid and therefore have a source of income to offset the tuition cost during the summer. We provide a great deal of help to our students when it comes to the internship. Many students enter the program with an idea of what field of analytics they would like to go into
column5: and therefore we set up opportunities for them to interview. We also send out a resume book which allows companies to view our students and contact them. But you are required to have an internship in our program.\r\n\r\nBoth GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program

column1: RE: Master of Science in Analytics deadline inquiry^Dear Liu\r\n\r\nTo answer your question concerning references
column2: we have requested academic references but that is only a suggestion for applicants. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column3: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column4:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate	Academic	Professional
0					3			0
1-3					2			1
3-5					1			2
5+					0			3

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

RE: Admit to 2014-15 batch-reg^Dear Uma:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your concerns about our current candidates
column2:
we do not exclusively take students from Mathematics/Economics/CS/IE backgrounds. The majority of our applicants are from those backgrounds and therefore they are the heavily represented students. I have included our class profile below. You will notice that 13% come from Business and Management Sciences. We do look for you to have quantitative and programming courses on your transcript.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants

column8:

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

RE: MSiA Program^Dear Matthew:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.  The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Please refer to below for answers to your questions:

 

1.       Typically we do not release this information about our students. We require a minimum GPA of 3.0. Since we do not require a GRE we do not provide average scores
column2: and we require a minimum of 85 in our TOEFL scores
column3: to gauge the caliber of students admitted into our program I encourage you to look at our Current students page which provides an effective class profile.\r\n\r\n2.       Due to the project based nature of our program we require our students to graduate within the 15months they are enrolled in our program. We are a cohort based system. You will be a part of a 9month industry practicum project
column4: which solves real world issues with business. Then you enter a required 10 week internship
column5:
where you will apply your knowledge of analytics in an internship setting. Your final project is a capstone project which is a 3month industry supplied project where you demonstrate what you have learnt at Northwestern University. Each of these projects are team based and are required to be completed by deadline. 

3.       Each year we aim to enroll 32 students to our cohort. 

4.       I encourage you to provide recommendations from whomever gives us the best sense of your analytics background. The guidelines on the website are a suggestion
column6:
but we would like to have a rounded understanding of what your analytics background is and what exposure/experience you have had in analytics.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column7: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: strong test scores
column11: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column12:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column17:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column21:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Academia
column25: 6% Finance
column26:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column27: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column28: and the deadline will be in February 15
column29:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column30:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

RE: Regarding MSiA 2015-16^Dear Mahadevan

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I apologize for the delay in my response. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions regarding scholarships
column2: our program offers a limited number of fellowships to our top candidates. The fellowship will cover fifty (50%) percent of tuition costs for the four quarters you are studying at Northwestern University. We do not require an additional application for the opportunity to get a fellowship
column3:
your application is the basis of our evaluation for a suitable candidate for our Fellowship. I encourage you to explore more funding opportunities linked from our Tuition and Fees page on our website (linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> ).

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
