column1:
RE: Queries regarding applications for Fall 2014^Dear Auroshis:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I apologize for the delay in our response time.  The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Please see below for answers to your questions. 

1.       We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column2: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column3:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

Professional

0

3

0

1-3

2

1

3-5

1

2

5+

0

3

2.       We will accept a scanned copy of an official letter from your college stating the medium of instruction as English
column4:
and I will mark it in your application as a waiver for your TOEFL score. 

3.       Please email your scores to this email address. 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column5: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants

column1:
RE: Application Deadline^Dear Rohan;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question; we do not accept students on a rolling admissions. We will not begin reviewing applications until after February 15th. No matter when you submit your application (as long as all of your materials arrive before the deadline) you will be given an equal advantage of all our applicants. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science

column1:
RE: Question on Recommendations^Dear Matt;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. I apologize in the delay of this response
column2:
I have been out of the office. If you require any continuing assistance please let us know. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column3: the three academic references are only a suggestion. We have a preference for letters of recommendation to come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column4: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column5:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

Years since completed undergraduate

Academic

Professional

0

3

0

1-3

2

1

3-5

1

2

5+

0

3

The application system will email your recommenders at the email address you provide. Recommenders will receive a request to address the questions outlined above as well as instructions on how to upload their completed letter into the application system. Recommenders may use standard word processing software for letters. For more information I encourage you to look at our website under Prospective Students. 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column6: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column7: so industry experience
column9: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column10: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column11:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column16:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Finance
column25:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column26: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column27: and the deadline will be in February 15
column28:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column2:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question about job placements we have not yet provided this information on our website. We have just graduated our inaugural cohort from our MS in Analytics program. We are currently working on updating our site to provide prospective students with this information. If you check our site after the new year you will see the job placement of our first class. The internships named on our site are a good indicator of the jobs our students took this year.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants

column1:
RE: Questions about MS Analytics Application^Dear Anqi:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question concerning Letters of Recommendation
column2:
the chart breakdown for recommendation letters is a suggestion. We encourage you to provide recommenders who can speak best about your abilities. We look for recommenders who can provide us with a picture of the type of student you are and how you can succeed in our program. If this break down will work for you then I encourage you to use 2 academic and 1 industry contact for recommendations.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score

column1:
RE: Questions about MS Analytics Application^Dear Anqi:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question concerning Letters of Recommendation
column2:
the chart breakdown for recommendation letters is a suggestion. We encourage you to provide recommenders who can speak best about your abilities. We look for recommenders who can provide us with a picture of the type of student you are and how you can succeed in our program. If this break down will work for you then I encourage you to use 2 academic and 1 industry contact for recommendations.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants

column1:
RE: Master of Sc. in Analytics^Dear Yoong:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 


Please see below for answers to your questions:

1. We began our program in 2012
column2: and on Thursday
column3: December 12th we graduated our first cohort. \r\n\r\n2. We accept 32 students each year into our program
column4:
we do not anticipate expanding the number of students accepted in the near future. 

3. We are entirely separate from the School of Continuing Studies. We do not share faculty or courses. The SCSs MS in Predictive Analytics is a part time program which allows students to take classes online and finish their degree on their schedule. Our program is a full time Professional Masters program which requires you to take our classes (with some flexibility) and finish within 15months. The hallmark feature of our program is our industry collaboration. We require our students to complete 3 industry sponsored projects which they will take alongside their class work. 

4. In regards to your resume
column5:
I have included a student profile breakdown below. Our students have a wide variety of academic backgrounds. You exposure to computer science in industry will translate in your resume and provide you with the necessary IT background for this program. 

5. We will not be able to accept your GRE score. We close our applications on February 15th and evaluate our applicants and provide our decisions on March 18th. It is not a requirement and your application will be reviewed by our committee. 

6. We provide a merit based fellowship
column6: which will cover 50% of your tuition fee. There is no additional material required to apply for the fellowship. We use your general program application as an application for our fellowship. I encourage you to research more funding opportunities on our website
column7:
linked here. <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html>  

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column8: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: so industry experience
column12: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column13:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column18:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column22:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 22% Information Technology
column25: 6% Academia
column26: 6% Finance
column27:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column28: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column29: and the deadline will be in February 15
column30:

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1:
RE: Raghav Bharadwaj - Application fee status^Dear Raghav;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us with your question concerning your application fee status. I apologize for the delay in the acknowledgement of your fee having been paid. We use a third party to collect and manage our application fees and therefore it takes a couple days for us to reconcile the payment. Due to the recent holiday we have been delayed in our response time. 

I have gone into your account and adjusted your fee status. You should see the change reflected in your student account within 24hours. I apologize for the inconvenience and I hope you have a wonderful New Year. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions

column1:
RE: MS in Analytics_Scholarship Information^Dear Priya:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question funding options
column2: The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column3: no additional applications will need to be submitted for consideration. In addition to the fellowships offered directly through the program
column4:
Master of Science in Analytics students may be eligible for other types of support. Resources may be found at the McCormick School of Engineering Fellowships and Internships <http://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/graduates/current_student_resources/fellowships_internships/index.html>  page or at Northwestern University's Office of Fellowships <http://www.northwestern.edu/fellowships/> 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column5: Average age: 27
column6: Gender mix: Male 69%
column7: Female 31%
column9:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column13:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column18:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column20: and the deadline will be in February 15
column21:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column22:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

column1:
RE: Questions about Application^Dear Ruijing;

 

Thank you for reaching out to us with your questions concerning your application with the MS in Analytics at Northwestern University. We have updated our application fee submissions this morning and your account should now reflect the payment. In regards to your GRE score
column2: we do not have an institutional code for the GRE. We request students to scan their test scores into our office via email. If you send the scores to Northwestern or the Graduate School
column3:
we will not receive your test scores.

 

To answer your question about our transcript policy
column4:
we require a scanned version to evaluate you as a candidate and only require a hard copy of your transcript after you are admitted. You can wait until you are accepted to our program to send in the official transcript from your university. 

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: GRE/TOFEL score report^Dear Vanessa

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2:
we will accept your scanned version of your GRE/TOEFL scores.  Please provide us with a link which states that English is the primary language of instruction at your university. I will then mark it in your student applicant page and you will qualify for a TOEFL waiver. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column3: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column4: and the deadline will be in February 15
column5:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column6:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column7:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd
column9:
IL 60208

T: 847.467.4520

F: 847.491.8005

 

Follow us on Twitter xxx@xxx.xxx 

 

 

 

 

From: Liao Vanessa xxx@xxx.xxx 

Regards

Vanessa

column1:
RE: question about admission requirements^Dear Jaewoo:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column2: so industry experience
column3: strong test scores
column5: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column6: but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. Last year we accepted under 10% of our applicants into the program
column7: unfortunately the 3.0 minimum is a hard requirement. Northwestern does
column9:
offer a Masters in Predictive Analytics through the School of Continuing Studies. You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/ <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/> 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column14:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column18:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column23:
4% Engineering

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column24:
Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant
column25:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd
column26: E278\r\n\r\nEvanston
column27:

F: 847.491.8005

 

www.analytics.northwestern.edu <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/>

Best regards

Jaewoo Lee

column1:
RE: Inquiry about the Master of Science Analytics Program ^Dear Rebecca:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

To answer your question
column2: our application period closes on February 15th we will be accepting applications until that date and releasing our decisions in March. \r\n\r\nBoth GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15
column25: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

column1: RE: Query on MS in Analytics program^Dear Saurabh
column2:
Thank you for reaching out to me with your questions concerning admissions to the MS in Analytics Program at Northwestern University. 

 

To answer your questions:

1.       If you could include in your application or in a note/comment that your undergraduate degree was taught in English then you will not need to submit a TOEFL score.  

2.       In terms of Financial Aid
column3: we offer a limited number of fellowships each year within the department. We evaluate the student cohort on a whole and offer them to our top candidates
column4: your application to our program serves as an application for a fellowship. The fellowship will pay for half of your tuition for the 4 quarters you will be studying at Northwestern University. If you are interested in more Financial Aid options I encourage you to look into options within McCormick and at Northwestern. We only control the few in our department
column5:
and any additional financial support will need to be applied for on your own. I have linked out page with additional links here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> .

3.       Admissions are determined after the applications have closed in February. We do not operate on rolling admissions. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column6: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column7: and the deadline will be in February 15
column8:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column9:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1:
RE: Request for Information on the Master of Science in Analytics program^Dear Shalini

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Master of Science in Analytics tuition for the 2013-2014 academic year will be $15
column2: 038 per quarter. Tuition is due for the fall
column3:
winter and spring quarters but not the summer.  

Additional expenses should be considered:

          On campus annual cost of living expenses of $22
column5: \r\n\r\n          Approximately $500-$1
column6: 000 for textbooks
column7: \r\n\r\n          $3
column9: \r\n\r\n          $5
column12: etc). \r\n\r\nThe total cost of the Master of Science in Analytics degree will be about $85
column14:
000 depending on the student's needs. 

 

To answer your questions concerning financial aid The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column15: no additional applications will need to be submitted for consideration. In addition to the fellowships offered directly through the program
column16:
Master of Science in Analytics students may be eligible for other types of support. Resources may be found at the McCormick School of Engineering Fellowships and Internships <http://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/graduates/current_student_resources/fellowships_internships/index.html>  page or at Northwestern University's Office of Fellowships <http://www.northwestern.edu/fellowships/> 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column17: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column21: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column22:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column24: Gender mix: Male 69%
column25: Female 31%
column26: Nationality: US 62.5%
column27:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column28: 28% Economics and Social Sciences
column29: 19% Mathematics and Statistics
column30: 13% Business and Management Sciences
column31:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column32: 28% Consulting and Professional Services
column33: 22% Information Technology
column36:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column38: and the deadline will be in February 15
column39:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column40:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market.

column6: then you finish your last quarter on campus. I encourage you to explore our Tuition and Fees webpage on our website for more information
column7: linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> . Similarly

you will find information about the fellowships we offer. We provide a limited number of highly qualified candidates a fellowship which will cover 50% of your tuition costs. These fellowships are entirely merit based. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column9: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants

column14:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

To address your question about the fee structure and scholarships offered
column2: the 2013-2014 tuition was $15
column3: 038 per quarter you are on campus. You will be expected to study on campus for 3 quarters your first year
column4: then one quarter is an internship (no tuition fee associated with it
column5: and can be paid)
column6: then you finish your last quarter on campus. I encourage you to explore our Tuition and Fees webpage on our website for more information
column7: linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html> . Similarly
column8:
you will find information about the fellowships we offer. We provide a limited number of highly qualified candidates a fellowship which will cover 50% of your tuition costs. These fellowships are entirely merit based. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column9: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column13: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column14:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column19:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column23:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 28% Consulting and Professional Services
column25: 22% Information Technology
column26: 6% Academia
column27: 6% Finance
column28:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column29: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column30: and the deadline will be in February 15
column31:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column32:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant 3
column33:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: A Question Regarding your Courses^Dear Morteza:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us at Northwestern Universitys Master of Science in Analytics. Our program is a full time 15month program which operates on a cohort system. Unfortunately
column2: that means we are unable to accommodate your request. Our students take their classes together and the courses refer back to the ongoing industry projects  which would not suit an external student. \r\n\r\nI apologize to not have positive feedback for your request. However
column3:
have you looked into the Northwestern University Predictive Analytics programs classes? You can find more information on that program here: http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/ <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/> 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions

column1:
RE: Question about application^Dear Liyu:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2:
we do not exclusively look for individuals who are graduating or in industry. We have accepted students who have an MS degree.  We currently have one student who has his PhD in Mathematics. I have included a student profile below in this email. I also encourage you to look at our Current Students <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/index.html>  page on our site. This page provides a profile of the candidates we are looking for. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15

2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

RE: MS in Analytics_Scholarship Information^Dear Priya:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question funding options
column2: The Master of Science in Analytics offers a limited number of fellowships each year covering fifty percent (50%) of the tuition expenses. They are awarded during the application process to select students and are based on merit
column3: no additional applications will need to be submitted for consideration. In addition to the fellowships offered directly through the program
column4:
Master of Science in Analytics students may be eligible for other types of support. Resources may be found at the McCormick School of Engineering Fellowships and Internships <http://www.mccormick.northwestern.edu/graduates/current_student_resources/fellowships_internships/index.html>  page or at Northwestern University's Office of Fellowships <http://www.northwestern.edu/fellowships/>

column1: RE: Information about MSiA program at McCormick
column3: we have so room for students to build what they want. If you have redundancies with courses we offer (say Java) then we will allow you to substitute with an approved course. Some quarters are more flexible than others
column4: but if you are coming for the analytics education we have built all of the necessary courses and skill classes you will need into the curriculum. What were your concerns with the curriculum? Some of our students who are looking to tailor the program to their own research interests
column5: will take on extra projects with Diego Klabjan. He has a great deal of industry projects happening at one time
column6: currently 18 of our students have taken on additional projects to help pursue their fields of interest. \r\n\r\n2.       Our classrooms are far from competitive. Our program is structured to be collaborative. Our main goal is to incorporate business skills in our classroom environment. We give our students ample opportunities to work on group projects and practicum project. Since the business world is built with analytical teams
column7: we expect our students to be able to work in that environment. \r\n\r\n3.       In terms of networking
column8: we offer a weekly social on Thursdays. We invite companies to come on to campus and recruit from our students. Our students then participate in a relaxed and informal networking session. We also offer lunches to network with industry contacts who come onto campus. \r\n\r\n4.       In the first 3 quarters our students are spending about 20+ hours a week attending classes
column9: 5-10hours on their practicum project
column10: and the remaining time is for them to complete project work and any additional tasks they have taken on. We typically build in days for working into their schedule when they will not have any classes. But their last quarter (the following Fall) our students are in class for 20 hours and working on their capstone project for about 20hours. \r\n\r\n5.       Students do have downtime
column11: some try to get involved with campus activities and they will go to football games together
column12: but it is entirely up to the students what they do as a group in their free time. As the above answer indicates it is difficult for the students to have lots of free time to take part in extra activities but they do most things in a big group.\r\n\r\n6.       Evanston is a mixture of college students
column14: and young working professionals. There are many students in our program who have brought their families with them and they are able to find everything they need within Evanston. There is plenty of housing to accommodate and it is a suburb of Chicago
column15:
and very family friendly.

Please let me know if you are looking for more detail to any of these questions. I am happy to help!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

Master of Science in Analytics

column1:
RE: Application Question^Dear David:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us with your questions concerning the Master of Science in Analytics program here at Northwestern University. 

 

To answer your question concerning your International background
column2: we do not have a preference for US students of International students. Currently we have 37.5% of students who are International. Many of our students have studied at US universities
column3:
and the one advantage they have is in their fluency. We are looking for students who have a strong understanding of the English language and who can communicate with both professors and industry partners. Our minimum TOEFL score is 85. 

 

And in regards to the type of degree we offer at Northwestern
column4:
we have a Professional Masters degree. Our culminating project is an industry based capstone project and not a thesis. 

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column5: Average age: 27
column6: Gender mix: Male 69%
column7: Female 31%
column9:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column13:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column18:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column20: and the deadline will be in February 15
column21:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column22:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1: RE: Information about MSiA program at McCormick
column3: we have so room for students to build what they want. If you have redundancies with courses we offer (say Java) then we will allow you to substitute with an approved course. Some quarters are more flexible than others
column4: but if you are coming for the analytics education we have built all of the necessary courses and skill classes you will need into the curriculum. What were your concerns with the curriculum? Some of our students who are looking to tailor the program to their own research interests
column5: will take on extra projects with Diego Klabjan. He has a great deal of industry projects happening at one time
column6: currently 18 of our students have taken on additional projects to help pursue their fields of interest. \r\n\r\n2.       Our classrooms are far from competitive. Our program is structured to be collaborative. Our main goal is to incorporate business skills in our classroom environment. We give our students ample opportunities to work on group projects and practicum project. Since the business world is built with analytical teams
column7: we expect our students to be able to work in that environment. \r\n\r\n3.       In terms of networking
column8: we offer a weekly social on Thursdays. We invite companies to come on to campus and recruit from our students. Our students then participate in a relaxed and informal networking session. We also offer lunches to network with industry contacts who come onto campus. \r\n\r\n4.       In the first 3 quarters our students are spending about 20+ hours a week attending classes
column9: 5-10hours on their practicum project
column10: and the remaining time is for them to complete project work and any additional tasks they have taken on. We typically build in days for working into their schedule when they will not have any classes. But their last quarter (the following Fall) our students are in class for 20 hours and working on their capstone project for about 20hours. \r\n\r\n5.       Students do have downtime
column11: some try to get involved with campus activities and they will go to football games together
column12: but it is entirely up to the students what they do as a group in their free time. As the above answer indicates it is difficult for the students to have lots of free time to take part in extra activities but they do most things in a big group.\r\n\r\n6.       Evanston is a mixture of college students
column14: and young working professionals. There are many students in our program who have brought their families with them and they are able to find everything they need within Evanston. There is plenty of housing to accommodate and it is a suburb of Chicago
column15:
and very family friendly.

Please let me know if you are looking for more detail to any of these questions. I am happy to help!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1:
RE: MS in Analytics^Dear Rahul:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1:
RE: Employment Placement Statistics^Dear Chad:

 

Thank you for reaching out to me with your questions regarding employment after graduating from the MS in Analytics at Northwestern University. 

 

Our program is preparing to graduate our inaugural cohort this December. We launched this Masters degree program in the Fall of 2012. After December we will be releasing employment information and statistics on our website. We understand the concern many applicants have for employment after completion of the program. Please refer to our webpage with statistics after graduation. Information we do have available concerning companies and positions our students held in Internships is available on our Current Students page on our website. 

 

Thank you for your interest in our program. Please let me know if there are any other questions you may have concerning our program or admissions process in the MSiA program.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

Master of Science in Analytics

column1: RE: the application fee is missing^Hello Wanyan
column2:
At Northwestern we use a separate system to pay for application fees. When we sync the two systems it takes a few days to be reflected on the student side of the account. I have checked our records and I do see that you have paid twice. I will flag this and follow up with our financial account manager and have one of the application fees refunded to you. 

 

Allow me a few days to follow up and get back to you with the refund for your second fee. Please let me know if your account does not show the paid fee by the end of the day today. I have manually adjusted your student page to reflect the payment. 

 

I apologize for the inconvenience and will have a refund for you shortly.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1:
RE: Application Inquiry^Dear Ashish:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us with your questions about the application process here at the Master of Science in Analytics department at Northwestern University. 

 

To answer your question concerning the official transcript
column2:
we do not require an official transcript until you have been accepted into the program. At that point we ask for official transcripts to be sent in so that you can be enrolled here at NU. We will notify you if we do require a hard copy of your transcript. 

 

We receive packets of TOEFL scores biweekly after they have been collected by ETS. I will update your application page once we receive your TOEFL. As of this moment
column3:
we do not have your TOEFL score. It does take some time to receive TOEFLs.

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions.

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1: RE: Hadi Khawaja - Interest in MSiA Program^Hello Hadi
column2:
What is your schedule for the week of December 2nd. We have been swamped with Thanksgiving break on its way and our office has been a little hectic. We would love to set up a 15-30min conversation with you that week. 

While youre on campus I suggest you getting a campus tour. You should arrange that with the Admissions office (linked here <http://www.ugadm.northwestern.edu/visit/index.html> ). And I suggest you contacting Bruce Lindvall
column3: xxx@xxx.xxx xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: M.S in Analytics - Northwestern University^Dear Arnab:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us with your questions about the Master of Science in Analytics program here at Northwestern University. 

 

Please see below for answers to your questions:

1.       A scanned copy of your GMAT score is all that is required for your application. 

2.       We receive both hard copies and scanned copies of TOEFL scores
column2: it is up to your discretion how you send it to us. We will evaluate both.\r\n\r\n3.       Your attached scanned copy of your transcript is sufficient for the application process. After your acceptance into our program we do require the official transcript
column3: but for now the scanned version is sufficient for our admissions committee. \r\n\r\n4.       We do require 3 recommendations. We understand this may be challenging
column4:

column1:
RE: can u please tell me the eligibility to apply masters full time course in your university^Dear Rama Krishna:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question regarding requirements/eligibility:

*	3.0 Grade Point Average on a 4.0 scale in undergraduate work
*	Transcripts from all undergraduate and graduate education attempted. ?
*	Three letters of recommendation that attest to the candidate's work performance and management potential.
*	We require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction.
*	GMAT or GRE scores are suggested
column2: but not required.\r\n\r\nBoth GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1:
RE: Admissions^Dear Greg:

 

Thank you for reaching out to me with your questions concerning the admissions criteria for the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

 

To answer your question regarding the criteria for our program
column2:
we do look for classes such as statistics or calculus. If those classes are not on your transcript but you do have a strong quantitative background my suggestion would be to sit the GRE and include strong test scores in your application. Then in your personal statement if you refer to your strengths in the quantitative field without be formally educated (i.e. the proof on your transcript) then your GRE score would support that. 

 

As a note 28% of our accepted students have an Economics and Social Science academic background. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

column1:
RE: M.S in Analytics - Northwestern University^Dear Arnab:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us with your questions about the Master of Science in Analytics program here at Northwestern University. 

 

Please see below for answers to your questions:

1.       A scanned copy of your GMAT score is all that is required for your application. 

2.       We receive both hard copies and scanned copies of TOEFL scores
column2: it is up to your discretion how you send it to us. We will evaluate both.\r\n\r\n3.       Your attached scanned copy of your transcript is sufficient for the application process. After your acceptance into our program we do require the official transcript
column3: but for now the scanned version is sufficient for our admissions committee. \r\n\r\n4.       We do require 3 recommendations. We understand this may be challenging
column4:
but in order to have a full understanding of candidates we look at what others recommend your qualities as. 

5.       We only control a limited number of fellowships each year. We give out a Fellowship (merit based) for 50% of tuition fees for the 4 quarters you would be taking classes. If you would like to look outside the program for scholarships or assistantships I recommend you to go to our Tuition and Fees <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/prospective-students/tuition-and-fees.html>  page and use the links for different financial aid options at Northwestern University. 

Please let me know if you have any other questions concerning applications here at Northwestern.

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column5: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column6: and the deadline will be in February 15
column7:

column1: RE: MS
column2:
Analytics^Hello Alok:

 

Thank you for reaching out to me with your questions concerning the Master of Science in Analytics program here at Northwestern University. 

 

To answer your question concerning out class profile
column3: we have 32 students accepted each year. Our core classes are designed for our 32 students
column4: and our electives are typically around that size or smaller. We do not require a GRE test score and therefore we do not provide the median breakdown of the students admitted. About 70% of our students choose to submit a GRE score to us in applications. The Average age: 27
column5: Gender mix: Male 69%
column6: Female 31%
column7: Nationality: US 62.5%
column8:
International 37.5%. And 73% of our students came into the program with work experience. If you would like more information and detail about our student profile I encourage you to look at our Current Students <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/current-students/index.html>  page on the website. We have provided information on academic backgrounds and industries represented by the students in our program. 

 

In regards to your inquiry about the placement of our 2012 class
column9:
once our students graduate on Dec 12th we will release all of the statistics from their class placement. We do not have that information public as of date. But please check back online in the coming weeks for an update.

 

We are housed within the Industrial Engineering and Management Sciences department and therefore we are qualified as a STEM program. 

 

Please let me know if you have any additional questions concerning our program here at Northwestern University. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1:
RE: Admission Questions^Dear Fan: 

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.


To answer your questions:

1.       We do not have any strict prerequisite courses
column2: but we look for you to have taken calculus and statistics courses. We are more focused on the quantitative background when we are evaluating transcripts. In terms of computer science backgrounds
column3: we provide a 2 week boot camp training session before our academic calendar begins. This boot camp brings in industry trainers from SQL
column5: SPSS
column6: SAS
column7: and Tableau to train our students. Some accepted students will enter the program with a background in Java and Python but it is not a requirement for applying. \r\n\r\n2.       I encourage you to supply your UNM transcript. You can list it as a separate education experience in the online application. When you do so
column8: it will allow me to upload your transcript under the correct heading
column9:
as opposed to uploading it as other

3.       Your decision to take online courses in Coursera should be included in your resume or CV. Many accepted students went that route to strengthen their application. Any certification of your knowledge will help make you stand out against other applicants.

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column10: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column14: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column15:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column20:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column24:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column25: 28% Consulting and Professional Services
column26: 22% Information Technology
column27: 6% Academia
column28: 6% Finance
column29:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column30: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column31: and the deadline will be in February 15
column32:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column33:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

 

From: Fan Xiao xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: ^Dear Jyothsna:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

 

To answer your questions:

1.       We look for applicants to have a quantitative background
column2: we do not expect them to have the extensive programing background you have but do look for an understanding of stats and calculus. We are hoping to bring in students with varying backgrounds to create a collaborative environment where the students can learn from different strengths within the program. If you find our information to be redundant to your existing knowledge in programing languages we allow for students to opt out of courses and take more advanced classes offered here at NU. \r\n\r\n2.       Unfortunately
column3: we are unable to provide you with the information about our job placement after graduating from our program. Currently
column4: our inaugural cohort is completing their final quarter here. They will be graduating in December
column5: and we will be updating our website with their final placements at that time.  The majority of our students were offered full time positions from their internships this summer
column6:
many are in the final stages of the interview process at this time. 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column7: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column9: strong test scores
column11: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column12:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column17:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column21:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1:
RE: Master of Science in Analytics^Hello Uche:

 

Thank you for reaching out to me with your questions concerning the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

 

To answer your question
column2: we are a full time professional masters program. It is required that you be on campus to attend our classes and participate in group project work. However
column3: Northwestern does offer a part time
column4:
online masters degree in Predictive Analytics. I have linked their program here <http://www.scs.northwestern.edu/program-areas/graduate/predictive-analytics/index.php> . 

 

Northwestern University offers two masters degree programs in analytics that prepare students to meet the growing demand for data-driven leadership and problem solving.

Master of Science in Predictive Analytics (Northwestern University School of Continuing Studies)

*	Online
column5: part-time program\r\n*\tBuilds expertise in advanced analytics
column6: data mining
column7: database management
column9: predictive modeling
column11:
as well as advanced communication and leadership

Please let me know if you have any further questions concerning our Full Time program.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1:
RE: Request information regarding MSIA^Hello Ajay:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us with your questions  concerning the Master of Science in Analytics program here at Northwestern University. 

 

To answer your question we are looking for students who want to receive a formal training in analytics (both predictive
column2: prescriptive
column3:
and descriptive analytics). We have students from a wide variety of educational backgrounds and various industries. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column14:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column18:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column23:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column25: and the deadline will be in February 15
column26:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column27:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

From: Ajay Chandramouli xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: Query: Prospective student on Financial Aid for MS Analytics program^Hello Aditi:

 

Thank you for reaching out to me with your questions concerning the Master of Science in Analytics program here at Northwestern University. You will find the answers to your questions listed below.

 

1.       Fellowships are applicable to every candidate. As our application committee reviews candidates everyone will be considered for fellowships. Our top applicants will receive the fellowships. It is solely merit based.

2.       In terms of other financial aid opportunities
column2: anything outside of what Fellowships we offer are not in our control. If you click on this link
column3:
you will be directed to our Tuition and Fees page on our website. I encourage you to research into options on the links provided. 

3.       Your application is your procedure to apply for a fellowship. The strongest applicants will be awarded a fellowship in each cohort. 

4.       When you receive your acceptance decision you will be notified of your status with a Fellowship. 

 

I hope this answers your questions
column4:
if you have any further inquiries please do not hesitate to ask. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column5: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column6: and the deadline will be in February 15
column7:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for January 17th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1: RE: MS. in Analytics - Transcript^Hello Vanessa
column2: Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column3:
we only ask for a scanned copy of your transcript be sent to this email address. I will upload it into our application system. Upon acceptance to this program you will need to send the official transcript from your University in order to matriculate into our system.

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column5: and the deadline will be in February 15
column6:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column7:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant
column8:
Master of Science in Analytics

 

Northwestern University

Robert R. McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science

2145 Sheridan Rd

column1:
RE: Curious Student^Hello Darren:

 

We currently have only had two classes come through our program
column2:
we are a relatively new Masters Program here at NU. Our first cohort had 32 students accepted but only 30 students enrolled. Our second cohort was the full 32 students. We will only accept 32 this year as well. In terms of project work and in keeping with our goal to provide a cohort system we are unlikely to be expanding the numbers much in the future. 

 

I hope this answers your question
column3:

column1:
RE: Request for application fee waiver^Hello Chandra:

 

Thank you for your interest in the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2:
we require the application fee in order to process and consider your application. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market.

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column3: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column4: and the deadline will be in February 15
column5:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column6:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1:
RE: Do I Need to provide a TOEFL Score (Northwestern U)?^Dear Weiwei:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. 

 

To answer your question
column2:
we will not require a TOEFL score as long as your degree will be granted by the English speaking University. 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15
column25:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

 

From: Weiwei Shang xxx@xxx.xxx Do I still need to provide my TOEFL Score?

 

Regards
column27:
Weiwei

^Master of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Weiwei xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: Admission query^Dear Trupti:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

 

To answer your question
column2: we do not require a GRE score be submitted by every applicant. Only 70% of our admitted students provided their scores. Therefore
column3:
we do not release our average score since it is not an equal representation of our students.  Submit your score if you feel that it helps your application and provides us with a fair understanding of your quantitative background. 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column4: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: so industry experience
column6: strong test scores
column7: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column8: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column9:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column14:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column18:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column23:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
