column1:
RE: Analytics Admissions^Hello Sean:

 

I apologize for the delay in my response time. I am relatively new to Northwestern and we have not had an inquiry like this before. After speaking with various people within McCormick
column2: I do not have great news. From what I have gathered
column3:
the BS-MS reciprocation applies to students who are going directly from their undergraduate degree into their graduate level courses. And when you had graduated from NU we did not offer this program. We have required all NU students to this point (recent graduates and otherwise) to fully complete our application process. 

 

You are a great candidate for our program
column4:
I encourage you to still apply. I apologize for the inconvenience but we do not have an expedited application process for Northwestern graduates. 

 

Please let me know if you have any other questions.

 

Victoria L. Richmond

column1:
RE: late application^Hello Kari:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market.

 

To answer your question we do not allow students to enter in the winter. We begin an 8month industry project (required) in the Fall. By the time the winter comes the students have completed a third of the project. It is mandatory for graduation and therefore we must have everyone begin together in the fall. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column25:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: Kari Bellew xxx@xxx.xxx any slots opened up so that a person applying now would be considered to begin in January?

Regards
column26:
Kari

 

^Master of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Kari xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: Information requested^Dear Premanand

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University.

To answer your question
column2:
yes. You are an excellent candidate for MSiA. We have a wide range of students enrolled in our program. We have students coming straight from their undergraduate degree and others who have up to 10 years' experience in industry.  

 The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Average age: 27
column13: International 37.5%. \r\n\r\nBackground by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column17: 3% Natural Sciences.\r\n\r\nBackground by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column22: 4% Engineering\r\n\r\nApplications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: and the deadline will be in February 15
column25: 2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest form if you would like to get more information about this session. \r\n\r\nI hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column26:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

-----Original Message-----
From: premanand tiwari xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: about MSiA admission-TOEFL requirement^Dear Jia:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. To answer your question
column2: we only require a TOEFL or IELTS for international applicants who have not had English as their primary language of instruction
column3: so
column4:
you would not be required to submit scores. Your undergraduate degree from a US Institution will waive the English Proficiency test requirement. 

 

The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column5: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column6: and the deadline will be in February 15
column7:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column8:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

column1: RE: Master of Science in Analytics questions^Hello Manjola
column2: I apologize it has taken so long for our department to respond to your request. We are very eager for you to see our campus and our program. Your request was unique
column3:
in that we do not usually allow students to sit in on classes. I know you are eager to come in this week but due to the current academic calendar it would not be the best time. Students are in midterms and they will be testing all week. 

 

We want to offer you one of the following two options:

1.       In January we have a guest speaker coming for a seminar lecture
column4: we would love to have you come and visit
column5: sit in on our seminar series and a class
column6: as well as a meeting with our associate director. \r\n\r\n2.       If you want to visit in the fall
column7:
you can take a campus tour and have a 15min meeting with our Associate Director. 

Please let me know which option works best for your calendar. Again I apologize for the tardiness in response from our office. 

 

 

Victoria L. Richmond

Program Assistant

column1:
RE: Admission Enquiry for Masters of Science in Analytics^Dear Aditi:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question we primarily will evaluate candidates based on their quantitative background. I see you have Statistics and Calculus on your transcripts. Those are some of the key classes we look at to evaluate our applicants with. We do not expect you to have experience in programing. We provide a two-week boot camp where we have industry partners from SAS
column2: SQL
column3: tableau
column4:
etc. come to campus for full-day instruction and informational sessions. You are not required to have a mastery of these programs prior to entering the MSiA program. We also include classes such as java as a foundation course in the first quarter. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column5: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column6: so industry experience
column7: strong test scores
column9: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column10:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column15:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column19:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column25: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column26: and the deadline will be in February 15
column27:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column28:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

Thanking You

Aditi Viswanath

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question
column2: we only accept fall enrollment in each academic year. Applications open for the 2014-2015 year on September 16
column3: 2013. The Applications will close on February 15
column4: 2014. Our curriculum was created as an intensive 15-month time frame
column5:
which allows for collaboration between members of the cohort. We do not accept Spring applications at this time.

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

column9: Nationality: US 62.5%

column1: RE: Can I apply for the 2014 fall term the master of Sience in Analytics?^Hi Shuhan
column2:
Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 


Our minimum GPA is a 3.0 and the average of our students is around a 3.5. I believe your numbers make you a qualified candidate and I hope to see your application. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants

column1:
RE: Interested in MS in Analytics^Dear Khurram Ali Kahn:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your question about setting up an appointment to discuss our program and admission process
column2:
my first recommendation is for you to sign up for out information session for November 15th at Noon CT. I have included the link below. This session is designed to answer your questions and give you insight into our program. We will discuss everything from application process to financial options. Our Associate Director will lead the discussion and then open the last 15mins to Q&A. If you have additional questions beyond that information session we will schedule a 15min phone call.  

 

To provide you with some common questions we have about admissions please see below:

1.       We do not enroll based on rolling admissions. We wait until applications have closed and then a panel will review the applicants. Candidates typically will not hear from our committee until February. 

2.       Out of the 32 candidates we select the top students for our fellowship
column3:
we have limited fellowships available and they are solely given on merit based. You do not need to fill out any further material for consideration for our fellowships. 

3.       The GRE is not a required component of our admissions process. Because we do not require it we do not have a true average for our enrolled students scores. 

4.       You need only provide pdf copies of  transcripts and any supplemental material (ie TOEFL
column5:
etc). Upon admittance to the program.

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column6: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column7: so industry experience
column9: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column10: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column11:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column20:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column24: 6% Finance

4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

column1:
RE: Questions regarding my application^Dear Humberto:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us with your questions about the MSiA program. Please see the answers to your inquiry below.

 

1.       I encourage you to submit your strongest score in quant. We do not exclusively evaluate based on quantitative backgrounds but that would be the most applicable field for our program.

2.       We do not accept on rolling admissions. We leave our applications open until February and then evaluate the candidates at that time. Even if you apply in October
column2: you will not hear a decision until March. \r\n\r\n3.       Since the GRE/GMAT is not required we do not provide means/averages/minimums for those scores. We encourage you to submit those scores if you believe they will strengthen your application. If you do not think they are favorable representations of your ability
column3:
you need not submit them. Our minimum for GPA is a 3.0. 

 

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

 

Master of Science in Analytics. 

 

 

From: Humberto Gonzalez xxx@xxx.xxx of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Humberto xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: Application^Dear Lan:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). Since they are not required we do not give out minimums or averages.  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program
column25:
we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: Prospective Student xxx@xxx.xxx sincerely
column26:
Lan Ma

^Master of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Prospective xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: Questions regarding my application^Dear Humberto:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us with your questions about the MSiA program. Please see the answers to your inquiry below.

 

1.       I encourage you to submit your strongest score in quant. We do not exclusively evaluate based on quantitative backgrounds but that would be the most applicable field for our program.

2.       We do not accept on rolling admissions. We leave our applications open until February and then evaluate the candidates at that time. Even if you apply in October
column2: you will not hear a decision until March. \r\n\r\n3.       Since the GRE/GMAT is not required we do not provide means/averages/minimums for those scores. We encourage you to submit those scores if you believe they will strengthen your application. If you do not think they are favorable representations of your ability
column3:
you need not submit them. Our minimum for GPA is a 3.0. 

 

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

 

Master of Science in Analytics. 

 

 

From: Humberto Gonzalez xxx@xxx.xxx of Science in Analytics^/O=NUEXCH/OU=EXCHANGE ADMINISTRATIVE GROUP (FYDIBOHF23SPDLT)/CN=RECIPIENTS/CN=OMA36151E^EX^Humberto xxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: Northwestern University Master of Science in Analytics Program^Dear Akshata:

We require 3 letters of recommendation from people who have had supervisory experience over you in a professional and/or academic setting. 

All writers are asked to address the following questions:

*	how they know the candidate and why they are qualified to assess the candidate's suitability for the program;
*	if they can identify any distinctive qualities and/or examples which highlight the candidate's suitability for the program;
*	if they can provide some point of comparison for the candidate against others who were in similar circumstances.

We have a preference for letters of recommendation come from academic sources but do recognize that in some circumstances this may be difficult to achieve or it may be that a recommendation letter from a professional source is entirely relevant and appropriate. As a rough guide
column2: the table below outlines a recommended balance between professional and academic letters of recommendation
column3:
based only on number of years since the completion of an undergraduate degree. 

 Years since completed undergraduate 

  Academic  

  Professional 

0

3

0

1-3

2

1

3-5

1

2

5+

0

3

 

 

From: akshata tare xxx@xxx.xxx & Regards

Akshata Tare

Cel : +91-900-468-3575

 

On Wed
column6: MS in Analytics xxx@xxx.xxx xxx@xxx.xxx Your password is: xxx@xxx.xxx \r\n\r\nIf you have any questions about the application
column7: please contact us at xxx@xxx.xxx xxx@xxx.xxxxxx@xxx.xxx

column1:
RE: Application^Dear Lan:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column2: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application). Since they are not required we do not give out minimums or averages.  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column3: so industry experience
column5: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column6: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column7:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column9: Gender mix: Male 69%
column12:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column16:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column21:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column23: and the deadline will be in February 15
column24:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: Prospective Student xxx@xxx.xxx sincerely

column1:
RE: MS in Analytics: Prospective Applicant^Dear Sruthi:

 

I apologize for the delay from our team in this response. I am very glad to hear of your interest in the Analytics program here at Northwestern.

 

To answer your question
column2: most candidates who apply have a quantitative background
column3: however we do not exclusively select students with engineering or mathematics backgrounds. I have included some statistics of our accepted students in the program
column4: 13% came from Business and Management Sciences. I encourage you to apply and then submit your math scores once you have completed your tests in December. We do not offer acceptances on a rolling admission
column5:
we wait until February to make our decisions and therefore would have your complete application in hand. 

 

If you are admitted
column6: the program hosts a 2 week boot-camp where we have industry partners from SAS
column7: SQL
column9:
etc. come to campus for full-day instruction and informational sessions. You are not required to have a mastery of these programs prior to entering the MSiA program.

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column14:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column18:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column23:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column24: 2013 for students entering in Fall 2014
column25: and the deadline will be in February 15
column26:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

column1:
RE: Curious Student^Dear Darren:

 

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

We provide a brief summary of our courses and curriculums on our website (linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/curriculum-and-career-prospects/Course_description.html> ). If you wish to learn more about the quality of education you would receive upon admittance to Northwestern University I suggest you sit in on our webinar information session. Our Associate Director will run an information session (information linked here <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Information-Sessions.html> ) which will provide more in depth knowledge of our courses and curriculum. This is also a forum where you would be able to interact with us and ask questions regarding specifics of the program. We provide all the tools necessary for you to excel in the field of analytics.

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
column2: Average age: 27
column3: Gender mix: Male 69%
column5: Nationality: US 62.5%
column6:
International 37.5%. 

 

Background by academic major: 38% Engineering and Computer Science
column7: 28% Economics and Social Sciences
column9: 13% Business and Management Sciences
column10:
3% Natural Sciences.

 

Background by Industry Experience (though industry experience is not required for consideration): 34% None
column15:
4% Engineering

 

Applications will be accepted as early as September 16
column17: and the deadline will be in February 15
column18:
2014. We are also scheduling an online information session for November 15th at Noon CT please fill out the registration of interest <http://www.analytics.northwestern.edu/admission/Registration%20of%20Interest.html>  form if you would like to get more information about this session. 

 

I hope this information is helpful to you. Thank you for your inquiry about the program

we are looking forward to having you as a potential applicant for Fall 2014!

 

 

From: Darren Thomas xxx@xxx.xxx 

Best

column1:
RE: GPA requirements^Dear Govind:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions concerning GPA please see the following information:

1.       We have our own conversion for GPAs taken out of a 10point scale. 37% of our students are international and a great deal of our applicants are from India. We ask that you keep your GPA and transcript in the original form and we will handle the conversion to our 4.0 scale. 

2.       Yes
column2:
unfortunately the 3.0 requirement is a cut off. We maintain a highly competitive program and receive many applications each year. One of our benchmarks is the 3.0 requirement. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32

column1:
RE: GPA requirements^Dear Govind:

Thank you for reaching out to us about the Master of Science in Analytics program at Northwestern University. The Master of Science in Analytics degree from the McCormick School of Engineering and Applied Science is uniquely suited for either graduating seniors or individuals with industry experience who wish to prepare themselves for the demands of the 21st century job market. 

 

To answer your questions concerning GPA please see the following information:

1.       We have our own conversion for GPAs taken out of a 10point scale. 37% of our students are international and a great deal of our applicants are from India. We ask that you keep your GPA and transcript in the original form and we will handle the conversion to our 4.0 scale. 

2.       Yes
column2:
unfortunately the 3.0 requirement is a cut off. We maintain a highly competitive program and receive many applications each year. One of our benchmarks is the 3.0 requirement. 

 

Both GRE and GMAT test scores are accepted by the program
column3: but neither are required for admission (though sending scores from one of the two tests is strongly encouraged to strengthen the application).  The admission for this program is very competitive and we do receive a lot of talented applicants
column5: strong test scores
column6: recommendations (a minimum of 3)
column7: and GPA are all taken into consideration. There is no formal GMAT or GRE cutoff score
column8:
but we do require a GPA of 3.0 or higher for consideration and enrollment is limited to 32 talented students each year. 

 

Below is more information about the admissions profile from our last applicant pool:

 

Profile of the 2013 student cohort: total number of students: 32
